response.answer_text: SSB is all about your personality .No need to go for coaching if you are a fresher. Just follow these simple tips… Read a lot  Get a good knowledge of all the things going in the world. You can start with a newspaper. You want to become a GRADE ‘A’ officer in GOI, you must be aware about the world and your surroundings. Must read about the force you want to join. The more you know, the better your impression will be. Your knowledge is your arsenal, you can not go short of it. Start forming opinions  The SSB is not interested in your knowledge, they are more interested in what do you think? You must have your own opinion. Not the copied ones. Your own, original and practical. Creativity is the key  This will go through out your SSB. Leader is the one who is creative and can change the status quo to make things better. This is the crux of entire SSB. Good fitness  Certainly not this level of fitness. But you have to be fit. It tells a lot about you and your approach towards the service you want to join. You will be running miles with load on your shoulders in academy you can’t let everyone think that this guy is not serious. First impression can make or break your game ladies and gentlemen. Communication Skills  Remember. English is a language and communication is a skill. You can not give leads if you are not good at communicating with others. It is said to be good at English which is a fact but one must be good at expressing his thoughts as well. Practice  Try public speaking, go on YouTube to get knowledge about the entire procedure. One must go prepared before the SSB. GD, lecturette, GPE, WAT, TAT, SRT, SD can easily be mastered with some practice. Reason  Ask yourself. Why do you want to join forces. Just to impress ladies, your parent want you to do so, to earn good money…. why? If you don’t have a genuine answer, probably it is too early to prepare for this dream.

Please don't giggle in front of the interviewer when he/she asks you you some questions like How many times do you masturbate a week ? What is the size of your dick ? When and how did you loose your virginity ? How long do you last in bed ? Who is your favourite pornstar ? See, there cannot be any right or wrong answer for above questions, these are just to check your presence of mind… Shocking thing was that my personal interview was conducted by two officers, one male and other female.(usually this doesent happen) Never lie to IO, but you can hide your weaknesses from him/her. Work on your weaknesses. I personally was asked in 2AFSB that was there a moment in your life when you entered a room and found your parents quiet and staring at you. Most Shocking Question Asked During SSB Interview. Do you have girlfriend/boyfriend?What do you like in your girlfriend/boyfriend?Do you have physical relationship with your girlfriend/boyfriend?What was the reason of your breakup with girlfriend/boyfriend?Why don’t you have a girlfriend/boyfriend?Have you ever liked any girl/boy?What do you hate the most in your Father/Mother/Bother/Sister?Do you watch adult movies?Who is your favorite porn star?Why don’t you watch adult movies?Do you smoke/drink?Why do you smoke/drink when you know it is bad for your health?Why don’t you smoke when your friends smoke and drink?What do you hate in your friend?You are not fit for defence, what will you do now?Why didn’t you try for SSB after 12th through NDA?Why are you not working anywhere?How are you surviving without a job?What do you hate about your current job?What do you hate in yourself?Why have you not prepared for SSB?Do you think you have officers like qualities?What do you think the top most qualities an officer should have?Q) Why do you want to join Defense Forces? A) Now you may tell the real reason because definitely a defense aspirant has a solid reason behind joining the defense forces, that reason may be patriotism, love for aero planes, ships, guns, craze for uniform, wish for an adventurous life or any other. Now one thing to be noted here is that boys, except for those giving interview for an entry after 10+2, should not say things like ‘Sir it was my childhood dream’ or ‘I always wanted to do this only’, otherwise IO might ask you that dude where were you after class 12th? Q) What if you do not get recommended this time? A) You have to sweetly and simply say that ‘Sir I’ll try next time again’. Now he may counter you by saying that if you do not make into defense then what? Here you have to show your chipku-pana for defense, you have to say that sir I’ll work very hard and make it, or I have not thought anything as yet except defense. Q) Do you have a boyfriend/girlfriend?(And for the obvious answer No-Why you do not have) A) Well this is your call guys & girls but if you say yes for this then be ready for a lot of counter questions and more counter questions IO asks regarding your personal life more you are likely to reveal yourself and I believe down the line we are not perfect. So to avoid any mishap simply say NO, if he asks why then you can say that I have not yet felt anything like this for anybody yet. Q) What is your belief of marriage? (Love/Arranged) A) Please don’t act smart (actually foolish) by giving a kiddish reply that ‘I don’t believe in marriage’ or ‘I have not yet thought about it’. IO expects you to be grown up at this age (Graduation people) . You can say that you believe in both kinds of marriages but the person you are getting married to should be acceptable to everybody in your family. Hence in case of Love marriage your parents should agree to that guy/girl & in case of arrange marriage you should agree. Q) Do you drink/booze? A) Aha now that’s a catchy one, for boys especially if you are going for UES or anything above college level then IO knows that most of you would have done at least once. So say the truth, if you do then tell that yes sir I have done it once or twice and if you don’t then tell I don’t. For girls, well you can say the truth as well there is no discrimination. Whatever you say be ready for counter questions if you are saying yes or sometimes etc. Saying a NO saves you of unnecessary questions Q) Why did you fail in previous SSB attempt (for repeaters)? A) Tell the truth what you feel, don’t blame the SSB that I did good and they didn’t take me or I don’t know, this gives a negative impression about you. You can say that I was not prepared well Sir in (say a particular thing) like psychological part. You can add up by saying that but Sir I have prepared well this time. Q) Did you do any special preparation for SSB? A) Of course you did! So tell him that yes sir I prepared for SSB from various sources like reading books on current affairs, reading newspapers, taking tips from websites especially dedicated for SSB like SSBCrack. In short you have to make him feel that you have worked very hard for your SSB. Bottom-line: You have to keep in mind that IO sitting in front of you is much more smarter than you perhaps that is why he sitting there. Also IO is fairly senior officer who has got kids of almost of your age, he knows what and how you think! You have got to be cautious about being over friendly with the IO, they are trained to smile and be polite so that you may speak as much as you can. But remember he is not your friend and thus you don’t have to treat him like that, at the end of the day he is responsible whether you make it or not, hence you have to very formal, polite and control your tongue. Hope this helps… Do not forget to upvote. GOOD LUCK out there…

The important thing to understand before going to SSB is Why you want to join armed forces? I know it sounds very clichéd, but trust me if u know the answer to this question very well, u will start going into that zone and frame of mind which will help you to take things and tasks given at SSB centre with utmost sincerity. I was conferenced out at the first attempt and managed to get recommended in my second attempt through CDSE entry for Air force. I dont know what exactly worked in my favour this time, but i can tell u what all things i did differently or how i approached differently this time. I had just checked my speed if i am able to do the Psych tests in time, rest i didnt prepare for the Psych or learned some stories or even decided the broad framework like i did during my last time. My responses were natural, i can say very natural even if my response to some questions is showing cowardness from one's point of view but for me it was practical response then I had written that only. I read this time my appointment with a psychologist book during my journey to SSB, it helped me too, to refrain from committing mistakes which everyone will do. You can surely give it a sincere reading.During the description part of self, i was having idea of what to write and i jotted down few points for each para in a very broad manner. I gave it a thought when we were given time of 2 hours to relax after documentation on first day. I gave examples this time to support my arguments which i wrote in self-description.Don't try to stress on i should match the qualities in all the Psych tests, just be natural and calm but yeah sincere regarding the tests, your qualities will naturally be in sync in all the tests. Don't try to be casual, i had written usually the first thing which came to my mind, but i ensured that i am making sense and not writing anything for the sake of writing.I read a lot, so that also helped me with the writing part and you can say language. So you can try reading a lot maybe newspapers. I usually read 2 or 3 newspapers and books, a lot of them. So it helps i know. You can give it a shot.Regarding interviews its better to know all possible answers to the questions which they can ask. Its said interview preparation is best done in the center itself as other people will tell you what is the nature of the questions being asked, but its better to prepare as u might be the first one too.So prepare about basic details about yours. Think critically about every aspect and follow up questions that might occur. Say if u say i like this person as friend, then question why i like him, what is the quality i want to emulate which is in him or her, when that person has shown that quality etc. Go like this for every relation, your brother, mother, sister, father, friend, teacher etc. Your personal part will be taken care of by this exerciseComing down to the other aspect of your interview, you should be again clear very much why i want to join armed forces and that should be reflected in your motivation to join it. Everyone knows what is asked in the interviews if u r serious enough with ur answers and have done the homework right for all possible questions, u will succeed. You just have to talk to yourself more rather going any classes or so. Talk to Yourself more and more.My interviewer admitted himself in the end that he is quite convinced with my motivation to join armed forces.You should be blatantly very honest with every aspect, for example, I mentioned after quitting my last job I am currently unemployed also, so that is also one of the reasons to join it. I mentioned how my gf motivated me to join it. So better be honest, u will have different confidence there.But keep in mind, while being honest, do not make it informal as it is equally a formal interview like other professions, The IO makes you comfortable, but it doesn't mean u start sitting on his lap. Moreover, if u r highly motivated to join it, u won't be automatically doing that stuff.I was physically also in good shape this time, from my previous attempt. So it helped me in IO.During GD and GPE, i was very calm and was having knowledge of the topics thrown to us, so i spoke less but i made sense. Be confident during those times, have a discussion with others, let other people speak also and listen to their points and carry forward the discussions.Another important thing is your rapport with your group. Your group should take you and your goals in life and efforts to clear this seriously. From the second day u will be able to make out who is serious for the goal and who is not. So try that your grp takes u seriously, even if it requires u to act serious act till the time of GTO.Rest enjoy your stay during the SSB, but during the tasks, u shd be damn serious like no one else is there. Remove the fear before going there, and stop thinking at the day 1 itself that whether I will be selected or not. It will hamper ur performance, u will anyways get the feeling if u r getting in or not after 2 or 3 days. So better give 100% to the tasks, and make friends and enjoy with everyone but never lose focus and allow things to get out of sight.In the end, I can say that I was mentally tough and took this as a challenge too after I got conferenced out during my first attempt. I would totally agree with the saying fear is the figment of imagination, and Mental conditioning is the most important thing.So give it a shot with utmost sincerity and try to be honest with urself at all times, following ur duties, time table, tests preparation, staying positive. I hope u will succeed too ASAP.

According to me, you need a lot of introspection before you appear for an SSB interview. You need to thoroughly analyze the 15 OLQs required for the selection. You should be in a position to identify the OLQs in which you lack and you should be willing to work towards imbibing them in you. You should be practicing these OLQs in your day to day life. Having said that, let us now understand the stage wise preparations which you will need to get recommended. Stage 1. Screening: Clearing the screening round is of utmost importance. Solve questions like the ones generally asked in the OIR test. The likes of these questions are easily available on the internet. Websites like indiabix.com may come in handy. Speed and accuracy is the key here. Also, work on your public speaking skills and group interactions. Group discussions are an important aspect of the screening process. If you are intimidated by the atmosphere and the idea of narrating your story in an open forum, then you must follow a simple trick. Stand in front of a mirror and speak on any topic loudly. Hear your own voice and practice the art. I am sure your confidence will definitely improve. Stage 2: Let us divide this in three aspects:a.	The Psychology Tests: Here you need to practice writing under time pressure. For TAT, try to write stories in under 4 minutes. Come up with original ideas. Do not mug up the stories you read or listen. Include past (what led to the situation), present (what is the picture showing) and future (what is the outcome / conclusion of the story) aspects of the story. For WAT, try and make short, assertive and factual sentences. This will help you in writing down the sentence in under 15 seconds. For the SRTs make sure that you analyze the situation clearly and then write a short, but complete solution to the problem. Time is against you in this task. For SD, make sure you know yourself really well. In addition to this, you should also know the opinions of your teachers, parents, friends and co-workers / boss about you. You should be able to write about your dreams (where you see yourself in the next 5 years), your weaknesses and your plan of action to overcome it. Remember that SD is the place where you first talk to the officers of the selection board.b.	The GTO Tasks: There is not really much to prepare with respect to the GTO tasks. A good level of fitness is a desired. You must be able to comfortably run for 2.5 km without getting tired and do some athletics with a good core and arm strength. This will go a long way in ensuring that you have an injury free selection process. However, it is important to note that fitness is not the sole criteria to get recommended.c.	The Personal Interview and Conference: A good awareness about all the recent happenings in India and the world at large will come in handy because then you will be in a position to form your opinions on these issues and talk about them with a sound knowledge. You must also be able to answer technical questions from your field of graduation for which numerous revisions are suggested. All of this preparation will help you in the tasks which you will have to complete during the course of the selection process. Your recommendation depends on it. I hope this helps. May the forces be with you. :) Good Luck !!

Preparing for SSB is nothing but changing or developing ones personality which best suits to become an armed force officer and develop the qualities which they possess or require to posses. The qualities are popularly known as officer like qaulities (OLQ's) . Let's see how preparation looks like. Answer goes a bit lengthy And I assume that reader has minimum 6 months of time to prepare for SSB from scratch. I will explain in step wise. I recommend all the aspirants to make a preparation journal, something like a note book in which you record every information about SSB . After making this book search about the SSB procedure and various tasks and tests involved. Total SSB marks (900marks) and there distribution.At the time of collecting information you will come across a very popular term called OLQ's. There are 15 OLQ devided into 4 factors which DRDO recommend the candidates should posses to clear the SSB. Understand each qaulities in-depth.For further clarification I recommend all of you to watch AFOSOP videos posted by col. Ganesh babu which are available on YouTube and are the best source for SSB preparation. I never come across such SSB videos because he clears every doubt about ssb and who Explains very briefly that SSB is not a knowledge based selection it is a personality based selection. Another video tutorial I found effective was dr.natarajan’s SSB videos but which cost 2300₹ on Amazon you can buy one if you can afford. He gives a realistic feeling of SSB tasks by actually conducting them in videos.By this time you will have every information about ssb. The next step is to find where you are now and where you want to be, by your performance and self assessment. Remember understanding yourself is the first step to prepare for SSB .Now you have to list out the OLQ in which you are good and OLQ in which you lag. For example the GTO task ‘lecturette’ reveals the power of expression which involves the good communication skills and content you speaks. now it is your job to find such things in all tasks of SSB.Remember, to recommend in SSB you have to get recommendation by all three assesment techniques which are psychological, interview, and GTO tests hence make sure you prepare eqauly for all of them.Prepare for a small topic every day related to social issues, general knowledge, etc as they want you to have an average knowledge about what's is happening around. Read news paper every day and have your own perspective about every issues. Don't forget to know every thing about the organisation you want to join.Involve in volunteer work in your college . Organize events and participate in every extracurricular activities. Be social and an extravert . Deliver seminars in your college if you get a chance. These will help you to improve your leadership qualities in a easy way.Read self help books to find tools for personality change and apply them in real life. Some books which help you are.Monk who sold his ferrariHow to win friends and influence people.Many lives many masters.Tuesdays with Morrie .Seven habits of highly effective peopleAlchemistThe road less travelled.The art of war by sun Tzu.Leadership wisdom by Robin Sharma .India's wars by Arjun Subramaniam which helps to know the organisation you wanted to join. It is indian military history from 1947 to 1971.These are strictly not the only books. I just mentioned the books which I read and found useful. You can go beyond this list by searching about the type of book you want to read. 10. Prepare your own set of principles to live on and it is nothing but your life style. Never cross them. 11. Be punctual and hit gym to remain fit. Running daily helps to build stamina. Concentrate on your health issues and cure them because SSB medical is eqauly important. 12. Now coming to target oriented approach here are the tips. Prepare your PIQ now only and update it on time base. Download a PIQ form to see what it contains.For OIR which has two booklets series (one verbal and other non verbal ) see following topics and prepare in advance. Refer Agarwal book of verbal and non verbal reasoning. Don't read TAT stories of other sources. TAT stories are meant to be yours so see a random picture in news paper or just convert your surrounding itself as a picture and write a story based on your perspective and rectify the same on time bases. Prepare a blank slide story of your own from your real life cases.Create your own SRT and respond to it honestly first and then rectify it later on time bases.To prepare for WAT train your mind to write observational statements not factual or suggestive as they don't carry any assesment wieghtage.For SD prepare in advance by asking your friends and parents .For GTO lecturette practicing infront of mirror does not help you hence deliver a seminar whenever you get a chance.For PGT,HGT,FGT,CT i suggest you to imagine a different variety of obstacles and then make a solution by using the helping materials. A thorough understanding of cantilever concept will help you through here. Remember here GTO is looking for the candidate who is giving ideas not the candidate who is executing them.For group discussion topics you are required to have a good general knowledge and have your own perspectives about social issues.Improve your langauge skills by talking in English every day now onwards.For interview list out the possible questions you think he would ask and prepare for it in advance and write them in your preparation journal to update them. Remember your interview is driven by your PIQ so be careful . You can decide your own questions. Be honest always.Remember it is never too late to start preparation but i suggest you to have a hard work of 6 months.Always imagine the way you want to project and behave yourself in SSB and inculcate them now itself ..or at least fake it till you make it and then attend SSB because in SSB if you fake you will be caught. …thank you all the best..feel free to comment. ..U..

Please don’t rush to grab ‘The Hindu’ for Current affairs or R.S Agarwal for OIR, instead understand the process first. The best way to understand it is to consider yourself in the role of assessors. ROLE 1: You are the Psychologist reading TAT WAT SRT … You have already seen thousands of candidates beating the pulp out of the burglars, saving the poor villagers & getting a national award for bravery or Getting back from stranded forest looking the direction of Sun/ Moon.TAT,WAT SRT etc is to see how the normal people react in some real life situations . The last thing they want to see is some superhero stuff or the cliched ideal responses. Think what you actually did the last time, when you saw an accident & what you wrote for the same SRT. Train yourself for closing this gapROLE 2: Interviewing Officer IO already know, marks of an average candidate will be decreasing from school to College level.To make up for this, some candidates will creates clubs & societies out of thin air & gave themselves the role of President or Secretary. IO will make you comfortable with his smile & with open ended questions, he will let your imagination take you to places. Soon you can see yourself organizing festivals or inter college tournaments, Guiding your juniors & becoming darling of teachers. Poor you didn’t knew, Devil was in the Details. After setting up you nicely, he will begin the grilling. With each question you will be pushed to the edge & before long, you could see yourself contradicting with your earlier responses. By now IO knew, he had the candidate & you can figure out his smile saying F*** you. IO tests for genuine candidates who wont get carried away or who will own up for his past life.Its okay if you don’t had any roles or achievements to showcase in the past. Many recommended candidates don’t have.If you feel bad about leaving those two lines in the PIQ blank, then start involving in some activity which you can fill up there- Train yourself for itLast thing one should do is to bluff at the face of IO.ROLE 3: You are the GTO - PGT is going on. From the word go, you see 3,4 guys rushing to get hold of the helping materials.Somebody will take hold of the Load & will never let it go,come what may.The one who couldn’t get anything shouts ”Lets use the plank to bridge the first structure” without even looking the structure.In the race against each other, none have taken a minute, to look at the obstacle & think about a plan.You could see a third guy climbing onto the structure where already two people are sittingIt is complete chaos & nothing is moving forward.The entire purpose of PGT is to test how well one can work as part of a team and if required lead them. Please note only if required. But candidates,for impressing the GTO with their exceptional problem solving skills or leadership quality, have forgot the basic quality for what they are tested for in Group Tasks. GTO will prefer a candidate, who instead of rushing, will take some time to devise a plan and still be happy to help others, get on the structure and execute their ideas. Those who jumping into the structure will eventually get stuck and you can often see this guy giving his ideas for them to execute. Most of you have heard GTO suggesting “If somebody have a better idea, let them come forward” for seeing this guy in action. Just think what you have done in your last GTO tasks and train yourself accordingly.SSB is neither Marvel studios nor are they recruiting superheros into Avengers for End war. SSB wants average candidate with humility & willing to Pick up Brass.  #Happy SSB

SSB is a Test of both your mental faculties and your physicals, it is also beyond it. It wants to test your team work and team spirit, your leadership qualities and your potential for becoming an Officer. You should have the endurance to stretch beyond limits, win willingness of your group and be honest and straight in your dealings with people. Don’t lie,don’t showoff and think before you speak. It is not how much you speak but what you speak. Communication is as important as your thoughts. Some important points to keep in mind,while preparing to face SSB are :- - Talk to someone who has faced SSB recently. He can be immense help in guiding you. To build-up your confidence, you need to know the procedure and method of Interview or what to expect and when. - Go through some books on the subject, to get a feel. It will give you exposure on the types of questions. You don’t have to learn the answers. The answers are either within you. - Coaching can only help you to familiarise with the Tests. I would not personally recommend it. SSB is looking for in you - what you are, not what someone has drilled into you. Coaching sometimes creates a conflict between your real self and the tutored. - Update yourself on General Knowledge and General Awareness of important happenings around the world and the country. - Build up your stamina by regular jogs ( they are not looking for your six packs). - Be truthful in your Interview (don’t waffle or hide ,they will catch you, without you coming to know). - Be positive in your outlook and remember all Group Tasks are to see your team spirit, leadership of a group and decision making. - Remember, the aim of SSB is to find out if you have the qualities to be a good officer or have the potential to develop into one. Some Tips The first Test is a screening test. You have to pass it to get into the main SSB Tests. It is called the Picture Perception & Description Test (PP&DT). Failures, are sent back the same day. PP&DT - In this Test, a picture is shown to you for a few seconds. You have to make a story and write it down. Your story must include what has happened, what is happening and what happened next. Write your own story, in first person, as if you were present there. What you saw and what was your reaction and contribution. The outcome of the story must lead to positive result. It must be your original story and not what you read in a book or was told to you during coaching. Candidates will be distributed into groups. Each candidate will be given 30 sec to describe the story and then the discussion on it. Each batch has to present their story. On passing of this Test, you will go for your documentation and briefing by the staff. Intelligence Test - You will be required to appear in an Intelligence test consists of two question papers. Each set consists of 50 questions. Candidates will be given 30 minutes for answering one question paper set. So overall, you will have to answer 100 questions in one hour duration.  Group Testing Officer (GTO) tests you for your team work, quick decision making and leadership qualities. Interviewing Officer will try and assess you as an individual and find out if there are any conflicts, in what you have projected in other Tests. Thus, the aim of SSB is to look for those qualities in you, which can help you in developing into a good officer. Therefore, if you undergo coaching in an Institute, then let it be restricted up to an exposure of what to expect in SSB. Don’t try to reproduce it in the SSB Tests. It is likely to conflict with your own personality. Be your own self.

1. It always leaves a good impression if an aspiring officer is aware of what is happening in India and across the globe. You need not be an expert in current affairs. But you must know in detail about 5-6 most important topics going around in newspapers and news channels. So, start reading any of the national English daily newspaper and start watching English news channel. Make it a habit. 2. Try to keep yourself in good physical shape. Again, you need not be marathon runner or a gymnast. You just need to be physically fit. Spend 45 mins daily in playing a sport (football, badminton, tennis, hockey, squash, basketball, volleyball), or go for jogging/swimming, you can also be at the gym or you can do anything else that helps you achieve this. Make it a daily habit. Dance/Zumba classes is also an option that many female candidates have adopted. 3. Turnout is the next aspect. Prepare 2-3 pairs of smart formals for yourself along with a matching tie. Nice black formal shoes as well. Be well groomed (smart haircut, no shabby nails, no beards etc.). It should be clear to everyone at the SSB that you have come prepared and you are giving the right respect to the occasion. Specially during the screening test and during the interview, you must look like an officer. Even your turnout for the group testing must be neat and clean. 4. Buy an SSB guide, download some SSB apps, read SSB blogs (quora answers as well) and talk to people who have already been there. Get a hang of what are you are going to be put through. It helps in mental conditioning. Practice writing as many stories, as many sentences, reactions etc. Try and do it as per time limits. A story in 4 mins, a sentence in 15 secs and a situation reaction in 30 secs. Apps and SSB guide would help here. Write 2 stories, 15 sentences and 15 reactions everyday. Before going for the SSB, you should have written 30 stories, 200 sentences and 200 reactions at the bare minimum. Remember- They are not looking for script writers or authors. It is just to check your thought process. Keep it simple. Don’t try and flatter people with your vocab. Make small and clear sentences. Handwriting plays an important part. Give proper space between words, proper commas and full stops, it must be clear and easily readable. Handwriting reflects on the clarity you have in terms of thought process. It may not be beautiful, but it has to be neat and clean. 5. Think about answers to these 6 basic questions: · Why do you want to join Army/Navy/Airforce? · What are your strengths and weaknesses? What are you doing to improve on your weaknesses? · What would you do if you are not recommended? Why were you not recommended last time (in case applicable)? · What is your daily routine? What is your routine on a Sunday/holiday? · What are your responsibilities towards your family on a daily basis? · What are your hobbies and interests? How do you get time for them? You must know quite a bit about your hobbies and interests.

SSB is a way of life, its all about us. By meaning ‘preparation for SSB’, it merely means, how do we utilize all the Officer Like Qualities (OLQs), the moment we utilize those qualities. During my preparation, I had a time of an year for preparation. Here is how I did it, along with some modifications that I learned there too. Start of by waking up at 0430–0500 hrs. Go for a run, preferably achieve the standard 2.4km in 10mins. This is not compulsory, but it gives enough confidence to negotiate all obstacles during GTO tasks. In real life, you will have stamina, mental toughness many times more than most others. It will keep you fit, active. You could wear any formals with finesse because of great physique.When you get up, prepare the bed. Wash your clothes on your own. Have a routine of things that you are going to do today.Study your academic syllabus, whichever degree you are pursuing sincerely. Basic Knowledge is checked, and knowledge is always appreciated.Watch news daily in the morning. News that has some national and international importance. Know what is happening in your state too.Wherever you go, or plan, always be on time!Restrict your own social media access, it distracts mind.Family - Family is your team since childhood. Live as a team lives. Be willing to help / assist them whenever possible. Analyze all aspects such as, good times, bad times when they supported, how did you help them how do you spend time wuth with them etc. Remember ever moment, qualities, details of your parents, siblings, if not already know.Friends/Colleagues - Spend quality time with them. Remember every good experiences with them. Help them when they need it. Remember their help when they did. Both is asked at SSBs. Remember past experiences with all. Analyze their qualities according to you. Optimize accordingly for Colleagues.Teachers/ Boss- Have you known about “Guru shishya” culture, you are the shishya, accordingly behave like that with a Guru. Submit things in time. No unfair means in exam, helping other students. Optimize accordingly for Boss.If you are a student, your sincerity will be measured by your marks, study diligently. If you are working, do things, take challenges, achieve standards.Whenever in a problem in real life, solve it yourself. In daily life apply common logic, will come handy in GTO.Whenever talking to someone, talk cheerfully, maintain eye contact and correct posture. Make other person feel good about them. Not senseless praise, just making sure everything is cheerful while in interaction. Practice speaking on any topic, like a lecturer. Will come handy in IO, GD, Lecturettes.Participate in Group activities, be it organizing an event, execution, or any post. Take responsibility and accept the outcomes.If you have multiple tasks, in a problem, prioritize and solve everything.Play games, atleast one indoor, one outdoor. Play team games in full spirit. There is win/lose in game. Just play with spirit. And know everything related to those games. E.g. - Football - weight/dimensions of ball, dimensions of field, clubs, winners, fifa, la liga, India's rank in world, what challenges, favorite player, why favorite, etc, everything. This entire thing is beneficial for GTO & IO.Have some productive hobbies, they are meant to make us feel happy, and skilfully better than yesterday. Again, know everything about it.Observe and question daily life things. Like if you are a mechanical engineer, you have a bike, know what is the engine, what grade oil is used etc.Whatever you do, do it with dedication.Help others whenever possible. Be kind like say thank you to one who opened door for you while visiting the Vodafone store or anything.Remember good times, bad times, how did you behave,what you learnt. Everything related to own personality.Keep an open, free, positive mindset. See good out of every bad situations, solve problems. Have a good mindset. Feed good things to your mind, no negative news, influence or anything. We become what we feed to mind.Have a healthy lifestyle, eat healthy, sleep on time.Practice writing Psychology tests. Many sites online have relevant materials.Before doing anything in life ask yourself - “Why?”. Very important.Keep a track of your expenses, know how much ypu spend, save on what, where, how etc.I remember just these for now, will add more if I remember.  So you see, not only in SSB, it will make us a great individual in real life too, one who is fit, mentally tought, varieties to talk to, easy to talj to, spend good time, dependable and what not! All the best, keep the josh high! :)

These are the following things I have learnt in my SSB preparation of 1 year which I would like to share Implementation of these things will help your chances of getting recommendation. a) PSYCHOLOGY Read psychologist AK Srivastava sir book AHAM AAVAM VAYAM.Practice TAT ,PPDT story writting according to the methodology given in that book first do without time bound practice once you feel desirable stories are coming by then you set time constraints for it starting from 6 minutes to reach upto 4 minutes in 4–5 months of practice.Practice dairy writing or content writing on blog ,quora etc to gradually improve expression and imagination.Improve IMAGINATION, CREATIVITYRead self help books like Robin Sharma's “Monk who sold his Ferrari “ ,” Think & grow rich “ , “Power of subconscious mind “, “Rich Dad poor Dad “, “Param veer chakra stories” , “love story of a commando” ,”How to influence people & win friends”Be more observant person with questioning attitude whenever you go anywhere try to learn something from it be it a railways station or metro learn about how they works ,who made it,what if terrorist attack here what would u do ? something like that to improve imagination as the content of stories for TAT & PPDT comes from such observing life experiences .Improve vocabulary & expression along with grammar.b) GTO Fitness :- Run atleast 2 km every day & try to extend upto 8,once running done do pull-ups, push-ups,squats for 30 minutes,if possible nearby to go military areas specially for army brat go there & practice IO available like balance beam,Rope climbing etc.Spoken English is the key which can be improved by regularly participating in GD, debates at school and college.Knowledge gives power:- Must add habit of reading newspaper daily and making yourself up to date with current affairs. Goings through the economics, geography, history,polity of class 6th to 12th will definitely help.Indulge into solving day to day life practical problems like fixing fuses of electricity, shopping for house,reparing basis things of general purpose, management of money at house, being a #Jugaadu person basically , military needs jugaadu people who has good effective intelligence and persence of mind & this can be developed by being more observant,active person who participate in various things and not just limit himself to academic.Push you out of your comfort zone,by being more productive & hard working.c) INTERVIEW Learn the art of filling the PIQ ,your whole interview is based upon the confirmation of things mentioned in PIQ alongs with some deep cross questionnaire adding some GK,SRT ,Life situations into it.If in college participate more & more in group activities so that you got enough things to add in your CV as well as PIQ from sports & coociricular activity sections, having great past achievements will definitely helps.See SSB crack most frequently asked PI questions there are many ebooks about SSB PI covering 200–300 different questions collect them all from internet and start answering them by writing separately on a dairy you must cover around 500 questions around your PIQ and life which IO may ask ,so that at the time of interview you can produce prepared well planned answer there is no harm in it every one give it a look on “Why do they want to join armed forces” like questions so preparation of answers to such questions can be done prior to interview.Again Spoken English & Current affairs.Make schedule for life and lead a routined and descipline life.

As per the statistics of last year(2016), there were approximately 5000 candidates who got selected for the SSB interview and to my surprise, there were only 200 who excel the howling success. In fact, the statistics of 2015 are even poorer where 8000 aspirants finally reached to the interview level but there were only 300 who made their way to the academy. After looking at these terrible statistics, one can easily get a clue of the difficulty level of SSB interview and as a matter of fact, there is no such sure shot way to crack it. There are merely 1 in 2000 who get their name in the final merit list. Who are those 1% aspirants? What actually they do? Which kind of strategy actually they follow? Let me tell you. They are just normal fellows but what makes them stand out of the crowd is their strategy. They have enthusiasm to do their best, but at the same time, they know how to tackle failures. And most of all, they are well aware of each and every little step in NDA SSB interview and thus, get the best of success. As i have already said, there is no sure shot way to crack SSB interview but if you know its pattern, then you will surely increase your chances of success. Yes, They follow a particular pattern. When i went into the depth of Interview process, i got to realize that a certain pattern has been followed by them. Lets just understand that pattern which should be the very first step of your training for SSB Interview. Introductory Question - to make you feel comfortableOnce you enter in the interview room, interview officer will ask you one of those basic questions which you are asked everywhere from your childhood. Your name, your family, your friends, your place, etc. and all you are expected to do at that moment is to stay original. Keep your lucidity at the pace and answer each and every question with confidence. Keep your every answer focused and short. This is the very beginning of your interview so make it start with a positive note.Usual questions - to test your originalityOnce, they will be done with the introduction part, the level of interview will rise a bit. And questions regarding your views for your family, for your friends, for the place you live, your extracurricular activities, your hobbies will start popping up. This is just to examine the real you. They actually want to know the inner being in you. Interview officer will present you some situation and will check that how you tackle it, how you handle the situation, and most importantly, to which level you ought officer like qualities.Just don’t go with the flow, think wisely and then answer.Social questions - to examine your knowledgeHere, your social knowledge will be tested. How much you know about your surrounding and social issues going around. They are expecting you to tackle that problem smartly. When preparing for the interview, just go through all the basic current affairs in newspaper which will definitely help you to answer in the interview. Listen to the interview officer properly, analyse the question and then answer.Practical Questions - to test your ability in your fieldHere, they will ask you questions regarding your field, your hobbies or your field of interest. Like, if you are a good sportsman then they are expecting you to show good team spirit and sportsman strategies. More than your knowledge, they want to examine your confidence in that field.The moment you understand the pattern of SSB interview, it will become easier to stand the test of time. But, understanding the pattern will be no use until you know how to tackle the interview. However, it should be own strategy, but still i am giving you some tips which you must consider while preparing for SSB interview.  Above are some basic tips. Apart from them, you need to take care of confidence on your abilities, knowledge, and experience, even to appear in the SSB interview. Your confidence is what which matters the most. What you think of yourself is much more important than what others think of yourself. So, never underestimate your strength. Confidence is contagious, spread it with positivity. Along with it, explore your Interpersonal and communication skills, self analyse your skills, goals, accomplishments, achievements, special interests and hobbies which are very much essential to leave a good impact on the interview officer. Make sense of every positive and negative aspect of your personality. Last but the most important. Try to analyse your real motive. I mean, ultimately you want to become an officer. Is not it? So, why not to act like one, right from the very moment. Start inheriting Officer Like Qualities. It will help you a lot in the interview. COMMON INTERVIEW QUESTIONS Pattern of the SSB interview is almost same and so are the questions. The style of asking questions may vary but you must admit the fact, that there are some common questions which are always asked in the SSB interview. Why do you want to join the defence Forces? Why you have only applied for Army? Don’t you like Navy and Air force? Do you have a girlfriend? Tell me your 3 weaknesses and 1 strength? What you do you think about the place you come from? What do you think 3 best qualities of your father? Why should i select you? Who is your best friend and why do you like him? I am not providing you the answers to these questions as i consider it as totally illogical. You should have your own strategy to deal with them. They may have more than one replies but one thing is sure that you have to answer these questions with a positive attitude. When they ask you about weaknesses or something in negative, it is expected to find positivity in that too. Neither, appreciate anything beyond limits nor to keep on criticizing. SSB Schedule  If analyse in depth, whole SSB procedure of 5 days can be categorized in two catgories, Psychology tests and group tasks. # Psychology TestsOfficer Intelligence Rating Test, Thematic Perception Description Test, Picture Perception description Test, Word Association Test, all are there to test your mental ability, intelligence and other aptitudes. Your writing skills and communication skills are also tested in this section. Take care of each and every answer as the level of your mind’s positivity, fertility and optimism will be reflected through this test. Meanwhile, psychology tests is your chance to show your officer like qualities. # Group TasksGroup discussion, Group Planning, Progressive Group Task, Individual Obstacle Task, Group Obstacle Race are included in Group tasks where you have to perform different tasks with the members allotted in your group. Generally, aspirants neglect to prepare for physical activities in group tasks. They are going absolutely wrong. GTO requires a lot of preparation and hard work right from the very beginning. Your team spirit, confidence and mental ability will be check here. Take balanced diet and work on your physical fitness. As Abraham Lincoln once said, “Give me six hours to chop down a tree and i will spend the first four sharpening the axe.” Hope, you find it helpful enough :)

If you want to prepare SSB for free - I will suggest you to watch AFOSOP video tutorials in YouTube so that you will be able to know what is seen in a candidate.SSB is a test of personality. Total 15 OLQs is seen in a candidate and candidates are tested on these OLQs. Atleast you must be aware of these OLQs.You can purchase some good books like SSB Psychological Testing book by Sir J.B.Mall , and a book on SSB by Commander N.K. Natrajan.Test yourself on these book because there are some example of TAT , WAT , SRT etc but don't learn them.Find the OLQs in which you are lagging behind.Try to improve the OLQ in which you are lagging behind by day to day activities in which these OLQs can be brushed up.Interview is the only part in SSB which you can prepare before SSB. Today most of the candidates are not recommended just because of -Not having good English communication skill.Coached Response.Not having basic awareness . This will also affect you communication part because only if one has good knowledge then only he will be able to communicate well.8. For GT part you must be physically fit and active. Since it is group task so you should be able to adjust well in a group. You should neither be dominant nor be shy. Behave like a normal boy. Active in response and a true gentleman. You can also purchase SSB video tutorials by Commander N.K. Natrajan to have an idea of the activities you have to perform in SSB. One more thing I want to address here that Stage I process is very important in SSB. You have to perform above average to get recommended in stage I . Prepare well for Verbal and Non verbal test. Picture Narration and Discussion is very important because you will be able to take further test then you must be recommended in stage I test and you will stay for 4 further days in SSB. You can improve you personality by - Reading English news paper daily.Doing some sort of physical activity daily.Having good diet.Having good knowledge of current national and international news.Having own perspective and interpretation of current events .Good Sleep.You can also take help from the Officers in Armed forces or Retired Officers. Blogs of Col. DJS Chahal is is also helpful. He writes blogs on olivegreen site. Nehru sir has also written blogs you can find it on Google. When I attended my SSB interview (Indian Navy) , the presiding officer (whose name will not be revealed) addressed a gathering of about 60 young men and said something I will never forget:- "We have no quotas here gentlemen, you are not competing for a given no. of seats, we are looking for a specific set of qualities and abilities, if all of you demonstrate such qualities, we will be happy to take in all of you, on the other hand, if none of you meet the requirements of this profession, none of you will be selected. Its happened before, it will probably happen again. Good luck"  We had three or four CW (commission worthy) candidates, all of them already serving in the forces, none of them cleared the pre-screening. We had Sainik School types at the height of fitness and confidence, and convent educated guys who probably spoke better English than Richard Attenborough, they did not get selected. At the end of the selection process the original group of  sixty had been whittled down to six. We later came to know that no one had been selected from the two batches preceding us and the one that came after us. Understand this clearly, the Indian Armed Forces are the one of the last truly secular institutions left in this nation of ours.  Work on your communication skills, learn to love taking on responsibility, hard work and delivering results on time, to take charge of any given situation and sharpen your observational and problem solving skills. The SSB looks for individuals who are alert, on their toes, focused and HAPPY about themselves. If you have a weakness, be it physical, or psychological, the SSB will find them, many of the men and women serving on the selection board have been in the Officer Corps since before you or I were born. try to deceive them and you WILL be cut down to size.  The SSB does not care if your father was an admiral or a village grocer, whether you were educated at Mayo or in municipal school, if the qualities outlined above shine in you, you will get through. If they don't, you won't.  Its really that simple. Good luck.
