The Service Selection Board is based on a very effective psychological approach. It is completely scientific and hence requires a candidate to be completely honest to himself. Despite several rumours, there are only two things a candidate needs to work on to get recommended. Be worthy of uniform.Do not fake your behaviours/ answers/actions in the SSB.The second point is self explanatory. You will be putting yourself in jeaopardy if you lie or fake about your personality in the SSB. It will more often than not come back to bite you. How to be worthy of the uniform? I am going to mention a few hobbies ad activities you can pick up 12–16 months prior to your SSB. Altering your personality trait takes time and it cannot happen overnight through some coaching centre. Make a list of your strengths and weaknesses. Put it up on your study table and constantly be aware of it. Work on a few of your weaknesses. Accept that no one is perfect and everyone has flaws.Start reading books if you do not. Books change the perception of a mind. Pick up autobiographies, non fiction, war memoirs or anything else you are interested in. Always be reading a book.Pick up a hobby. A hobby defines a man of substance. It can be anything that you are interested in.Start reading the newspaper. A major problem with candidates is that they have never touched a newspaper in their life. A newspaper is still worth it when it comes to current affairs and opinions.Start respecting people around you, do not indulge in name calling, bullying and other activities on grounds of religions, caste or place.Take up more responsibilities at your home.Start playing a sport if you do not or just start running. The idea is to sweat and to keep yourself in shape.Learn about International relations, specially around our subcontinent. It is quite interesting as well.Start valuing your self worth, often candidates have been found to have lack of confidence and yet end up portraying over confidence.Understand that only when all your three aspects, “Talking, Thinking, Doing” are in sync you will be recommended. Of course, you have to be worthy as well.And remember, please do not join coaching classes. It is a waste of your time and money. All of them are interested only in financial gains.

Reach a day before: Prepare yourself for a five-day schedule of the SSB. You need to reach a day before the first day, when you will be briefed on details of the next five days, code of conduct to be maintained, etc. Be confident: Maintain a confident and positive frame of mind and believe in your capabilities. After all, you've come this far from among thousands of candidates. First day: On the first day of the schedule, basic intelligence and verbal and non-verbal reasoning skills are evaluated. You are asked to see a picture of thirty seconds duration and describe it in a story form. Later, group discussions are held in batches to select the most suitable story. To do well in this section, go through the last few years' question papers to get an idea. Solve papers of different aptitude tests. Get involved in GDs and debates whenever you get time. These will improve your verbal and non-verbal skills. Practice writing & analyzing: Practice writing about anything you see, for instance, the boy playing in the park or the girl on a school bus. Write small stories and monitor your timing. The story should include seven parameters such as sex, mood, age, character, past, present and future of a situation that the character of your story is in. Analyse the story. Things to keep in mind for the GD session: Do not look at the officers while narrating your story and just after completing it.Proper body language should be maintained.Do not argue in the GD; allow others to speak, including the weaker ones.Wait for the right time to put in the strong points of the story that you have written.Try to be actively present in the discussion so that the officers notice you.Second Day: The second day is considered very important. Thematic Appreciation Test (TAT), Word Association Test (WAT), Situation Reaction Test (SRT) and Self Description are undertaken, all of which are part of psychological process. These are all general psychology tests that demand your extensive attention and concentration. Self-description: Prepare for it beforehand. The psychologists usually look for your: Ability to self analyzeAim in life and determinationThinking and mentality regarding parents, family, friends, neighbours, teachers and others.Perception of how your parents, family, friends, neighbours, teachers and others analyse you.Preparations for next two days: The Group Testing Officers (GTO) activities conducted on the third and fourth days include various indoor and outdoor group activities like Group Discussion, Group Obstacle Race, Group Planning and Progressive Group Tasks. The individual tasks consist of Individual Lecturette, Individual Obstacles and Command Tasks. These tests are conducted to evaluate you as a team player in various situations as also as an individual. It also assesses your leadership qualities and the way you express yourself. Perform all the tasks in a calm and composed manner. Personal interview: The officers can take your Personal Interview (PI) on any day between second to fourth days, so be mentally prepared for it. Fifth day: The fifth day generally comprises closing address by the board's Deputy President, conference and announcement of results, followed by dispersal. Personality development: For SSB, it is not important that you should be a highly intelligent person but should be strong, mature and posses a well-developed personality. Keep fit: It is essential to keep fit so that you can conduct all the physical activities with ease. A good heath will also help you to get a clearance in the medical tests.  Some Recommended Books SSB Interview: The Complete Guide by Dr. (Cdr.) Natarajan, Arihant PublicationsSSB: What? How? And Why? by J.B. MallModern SSB Interviews by Col. Kuldip S. DosanjhSSB Interviews & Psycho Intelligence Tests by R. Gupta

The most important advice that I would like to give is that although every test is made to appear like a 'competitive examination', it is not necessarily so.  The SSBs are testing you for your 'Officer Like Qualities'.  The main things here are your abilities to obey orders, take independent decisions, explain the logic behind the decisions that you have taken, the confidence with which you 'attack' each problem etc.,   To exaggerate what they (the people in the board) are looking for, I will even say that you don't have to solve all problems that are posed to you but whatever you have solved, should be done in a logical manner.  I don't mean to imply that you can really give up some tests without reason but, giving up something does not mean that you get disqualified.  I was selected by the first AFSB where I appeared for tests (year 1980) and when I went there, I had no idea about what the tests were going to be like.  In the physical tests where I was given a chance to go through those ten obstacles (each having different marks depending on the perceived difficulty level) in a limited time, I chose to go through them in a sequence ignoring what mark each one carried.  While going through "Tarzon Jump", I slipped and the skin on my right palm was partially peeled off -- I was bleeding from the side of the palm.  I went through one more obstacle after that.  In the next one which was a wall, I jumped up and caught the top but, could not heave myself up to clear above it.  There was one more obstacle left --- I mean I had totally cleared eight obstacles and two were left.  And, I had some time left still.  I just walked off direct to the GTO and showed him my bleeding hand --- I was directed to the medical assistance room where treatment was given for that injury.  In spite of the fact that I did not complete that portion, I was selected!!!! In short, they are not counting your points for individual tests but, giving you an overall assessment based on the way you go about solving the problem. Even during the interview, please note that they expect you to say "I don't know sir" or probably "I can't do that sir" at some stage.  None of the situations that they present before you have a single "standard answer".  Each individual can give his own view (or, a different solution) for the same problem.  Based on the answer you give, the grilling continues deeper and deeper till you give up or probably, the officer asking the questions is stuck for any further arguments.  Please do not hesitate to say "I don't know" when you are really stuck.  At the same time, don't be too quick to come out with that answer because then, you would be projecting yourself as an idiot.  Never try to bluff your way through because if you do that, they will be able to find out from your further answers.  If that happens, you can rest assured that you will NOT be recommended.

We all know about all those personality development tips and SSB hacks etc. and there are many answers, blogs, YouTube videos and websites dedicated to them. I won’t add another answer about the same things that have already been talked about. Here are some preparations that I think that many candidates do not do but should do (not necessarily in order) : Shave : Sounds obvious but I have seen many candidates appearing for the interview without shaving. It shows your casual approach and means that you are not serious about your interview. Many get screened out because of this. Also, make sure you get a proper hair cut. All those funky fashionable hairstyles are not allowed there.Pack whatever is required : Sounds obvious again but many candidates forget to bring basic things like soap, shaving kit, pen etc. Some candidates even forget to bring important things like GTO dress, shoes, tie etc. Please make sure that you pack everything that you need to pack so that you do not have to depend on others.Prepare documents in advanced : Many candidates face trouble on the first day itself because they do not bring the required documents. When you get your call letter, prepare your documents on that day itself. Make sure you have atleast 5–6 copies of each document as well. You can only get recommended if you are allowed to give SSB and you are allowed to give SSB only when your documents are verified.Have some basic knowledge about the armed forces : Sounds obvious again but I have seen many candidates who have no idea about the forces and some don’t even know why they are here. Please do not be that person! Learn about how the defence forces work, learn about the different regiments, divisions etc.Work on your fitness : Though it is not necessary but being in good shape makes you more confident. More confidence means better communication skills. Better communication skills means you perform better in PPDT, GD, Lecturrette and Interview. Not only that, being in good shape makes you look more confident. Your overall body language would be more positive and full of confidence. All this can increase your chances of getting selected. Also, no one likes to have a fat overweight group member in tasks like FGT, PGT, Command task, Group Race etc.Hope this helps. Good Luck for your SSB!

Hello there, Firstly an introduction about myself:A mechanical engineer graduate from Mumbai. Shortlisted in SSBs after clearing NDA, CDS and AFCAT exams. 6 attempts: 4 Conferenced out, 2 Screened out I’m typing a few key points I had followed while preparing for my SSBs. Self Introspection is the key to get a recommendation. The very reason for you to be toiling hard for 5 days should be more than just love for uniform, aircraft or tankers. Figure out what you are, what have you done in the past and what do you want to become.A solid reason to recommend you to be one among the coveted cadet. It may be because of your family background otherwise your zeal towards armed forces. In short, you should have a story.Mental toughness to endure long hours of testing irrespective of the weather. Day 1 at AFSB starts at 6.00 am and lasts as long as 11.00 pm which is also the most crucial day when they test your psychometry.General awareness of both local and global happenings which will add merit to your points during group discussion and Lecturette. There will be a handsome number of GA questions in PI too.Ability to collectively work as a team in GTO tasks and giving respect to each and every idea from the fellow candidate however absurd might that be. This will test your leadership skills.Not getting carried away by the leniency of the Interviewing Officer in PI as this is their way of getting the slightest mistake you might have done. Just think about his rank and don’t fumble.Finally, your physical strength. This is not essential but which GTO officer hates a well-built cadet.The list goes on but this is what I felt can take you leaps ahead if you sort all of these. Hope my response helped you. Jai Hind.

My answer is only to train for SSB. I believe the most part of it is to be aware of what is being assessed. I do not endorse any shortcuts ! (Many have already shared their tips for succeeding SSB, so I skip that part). I really like the framing of question. One can crack SSB only with little training , not my preparing. Before going into the tips for cracking, let me justify the whole process of SSB interview. SSB is definitely one of the toughest selection procedure. For the record, the rejection ration of SSB is even higher than that of Civils exam ! SSB selection procedure is test the ‘personality’ of the candidate. Personality of a person is primarily because of his ‘states’ of mind. There are broadly 3 states of mind which the personality reflects. Subconscious state of mind .Semi-subconscious state of mind.Conscious state of mind .All these state of minds gets unfolded in different tasks which are designed in SSB. 1.Subconscious state of mind . What ever and how ever you may try, you can never change this state of mind. Its even good not to ! Psychology tests are primarily to test this aspect of you. There are many who try to prepare WAT, TAT etc etc before hand and write in the SSB. You can (and should) definitely improve your english and writing skills. You should be able to ‘clearly’ imprint the idea you generate on the paper. But trying to learn ‘how they have to written’ is a wrong thing to do ! [This is my personal opinion.If you are trying to impersonate and fake your psychology in the test, for the most part you will be spotted and rejected. Even if you make through the selection, for you and the force,both might get effected in a bad way ! This is our country. Lets put our best and showcase ‘ourselves’. If we are not suitable for the force , let the suitable get selected . If you are really patriotic, join some other form of working service for our country. ] In the description test, just have an idea of what people think of you. Try to cover the most important (which you feel are) first , and then write the rest. Sometimes, you might really find hard to write long paragraphs. So keep practicing of writing. You should be genuine in the entire selection process. What you write in Psychology test might be read by your interviewing officer. Just to see you are genuine or not ! 2. Semi-Subconscious state of mind : Primarily Personal interviews showcase this aspect. You have to be aware of your own life. You have to be clear in what you say. Each and every word of it ! Just go through the editorials of a week before and know the current happenings in the world. your hobbies (which you will mention in OIR) should be really your hobbies ! What I mean is if your hobby is ‘to play cricket’, know the basics of cricket and the happenings in that. Personal interviews are always the best way to put your personality. You should not think too much on what has been asked. Lets say, if your interviewer asks you “Which is your favorite color?” Don’t go for a big lecture on the concepts of colors ! Some of you might have read somewhere that humans and some other animals have color conflict. What is red for us is blue for some other animal. Just say the color name ! Semi-subconsciously you will be digging your memory and speaking it out. After some time, the process just goes spontaneously. 3. Conscious State of mind : GTO ! There is nothing to explain here. Group planning demands you to stay in the present. I was very weak in Individual Obstacles. Once my palm even went burnt off ! In the later SSBs, I was very comfortable with this ! I made my hands very strong. Especially palms. When you are attempting the rope obstacles , makes sure that you are holding it too tightly. If you know that your fist is not powerful , here is the tool. Buy Fitness Hand Accessories & Belts Online In India|Essential Hand Grip Black|Domyos  Message me if you are interested to know further more.

First and foremost, try and identify your strengths and weakness. Improve on your strengths and correct the shortcomings in you. Have a positive attitude and try and develop OFFICER LIKE QUALITIES(OLQs). Your behavioral aspects are reflected in every test that you undergo at the SSB. For Screening stage, you can appear for the Officer’s Intelligence Rating test by having a good logical, reasoning and language skill. Practicing model questions will help you. For the second part, that is the PPDT, practice with sample pictures, and try and improve your imagination. It will also help you in identifying the speed of writing you’d require. For the GD that follows, practice presenting your story in front of the mirror. It will help you overcome the stage fright as well as improve your speaking skills in English. Try and hold mock GDs with your friends. Focus on your manners and conduct, and the way you help in directing the GD including all the members. For the Psychological tests(WAT, TAT, SRT, Self description), the best preparation is observation and practice. Observing your surroundings would help you in deriving very ingenious responses in WAT and SRT. It will show who you are as an individual. Be original. Don’t try to mug up the responses from practice tests and produce it there. For TAT, practice with various pictures, and let your imagination flow free. For WAT, TAT and SRT, try and improve on your responses. It will lead you to getting better at it each time. For Self description, have an idea of who you are, and how you are seen, in perspective of your parents, teachers and friends, besides yourself. For group tasks, for GD and lecturette, follow the practice as stated for the gd in PPDT. Be updated. Read newspapers. For the rest, do exercises to keep you in shape. The aim is to remain calm and collected, and to think logically. When part of the team, always think for the team, not for yourself. For the interview, remember the facts that you presented in the PIQ. Answer to sample questions, listen to your answers and improve on your answers, so that when a similar question pops up for the real one, you know how to answer it. Give a straight answer to questions. Be aware of the details of your family members, your locality, the places you grew up. Never bluff. It will eventually lead to your doom. Besides these, focus on improving yourselves as a responsible citizen of our country. Remember, preparation for SSB is not just meant for the 5 day test that you may undergo. See it as an opportunity to mould yourself into a better version of yourself. All the best!

Considering you meant “How can I prepare for the SSB interview?” You can't 'prepare' for the SSB interview. You can practice. You won't know what the Interviewing Officer might ask. If you have some friends who have received a SSB call letter, then you guys can do mock interviews. Ask basic questions like: “Tell me about yourself. Your interests, your hobbies, what fascinates you in life, your source of motivation for joining the Defence Forces.” “Tell me about your academic life. Your friends at school, your teachers, whom you like , who motivated you the most, who didn't, your relationship with your teachers, your pranks at school.” “Tell me about your social life, your Facebook friends, your girlfriends/ boyfriends, your breakups.” “Okay suppose you face a major problem in your life. Who do you approach first and why?” “If I ever get the chance to meet your friends, which two qualities would they state about you as your weakness?” Trust me the list is infinitely long. Remember, everything you've done in life must have had an intention and a motive. You need to find out that. For example, You had joined NCC in your school life.You must know why you had joined it. You can say, because you wanted to have a glimpse of a military training. Just make sure you give examples for whatever you say there, like: “Sir, I was a very obedient and a sincere boy at school who always obeyed to his teachers.” Prove it now. You can say, “Sir, my class teacher made me the class monitor several times in school, and I always did my homework.” (Which reflects the above stated qualities) Don't try to show off by saying something which you never did. Don't crack a filmy dialogue. The Interviewing Officer (IO) might smile at your dialogue, but you won't be able to smile on the Conference Day :) Giving examples to whatever you say would make the statement sound more genuine. The IO won't feel that you are bluffing. Giving examples will actually generate more interest in the IO to hear more from you. That's what you need. Once that happens, Congo! You are selected! If you've played many pranks at school, mention it openly. Don't try to hide any thing from him. He has interviewed thousands of candidates like you. Treat him like a friend, who is elder to you in age. Keep smiling when you answer his questions. Maintain a proper body language while answering. Remember. You will be judged for a single rub you make on the tip of your nose. Be careful.  Maintain eye contact with the IO. This willake you look more focused. Try not using your hands too much. Its fine occasionally. He will try his best to create stress in your mind by sounding rude at times. At that moment he is just checking how you react on facing pressure from someone senior. So you can gather information about what all you have done in life. You must have the basic knowledge of the sports you've played. You are entitled to know some General Knowledge and News. Practice and discuss among your friends. Talk in English as much as possible, among your friends or with your parents. Improve your communication skills and body language. Exercising helps in improving body language, and boosts confidence. Start it today. Relax and all the best! -ASK Image courtesy : Google Images

First is "PHYSICAL" :  run 3 kms daily,  do 3 sets of 10 pull ups , 3 sets of 30 push ups and 3 sets of 35 crunches. Second is boost your "CONFIDENCE" by speaking in front of mirror with people and also record your speech and analyze your mistakes from that. Third is "INTROSPECT" and find your weaknesses , strengths and also ask your friends , parents and person who spends most of his time with you about yourself. Fourth is improve your "GENERAL AWARENESS" and try to give opinion of the events that are waving in news. Now I am going to tell you that how to perform in ssb My freind ssb is all about practice and luck so practice as much as you can and believe in god  Firstly for 'ppdt' and 'tat' practice at least 50-60 pictures , do timely writing practice of pictures and also narrate 7-8 stories daily in front of mirror. Then for psychology i.e. for 'tat', 'wat' , 'srt', 'sd' for 'wat' and 'srt' you have to have good writing as well as good writing speed so practice from youtube or make slides by yourself of those words which are available on SSBCrack and on any other website. for 'sd' prepare your 'self description' before attending ssb. Interview depends on interviewer's mind he can ask about you, your family and things you did till date. So for this prepare answer by yourself. like he can ask you following questions : Tell me about your education Tell me about your friendsTell me  about your teachersTell me about the activities you did in school and collegeTell me about your motherTell me about your father Tell me about your siblingsTell me about activities you do at home.your strengths and weaknessesyour hobbieshe will definitely ask you about general awareness like 'what happen in this month'.So prepare detailed news of that month in which you are appearing and your opinion of each and every news. Be prepare for question about army, airforce or navy. for GTO:  1 group discussion here your knowledge about that topic will help you. 2 'gpe' be practical , think about different resouces available in the task and give your solution with proper reasoning. 3 'lecturette' : for this give speech on the topics that are available on SSBCrack and also record those lecturette and find mistakes and try to improve yourself regularly. 4 'PGT', 'HGT', 'FGT' and 'CMD TASK': Help your group mates to solve the task and to practice for these obstacles see images on google and try to analyze the obstacle. 5 'IO', 'SNAKE RACE' : Remember don't become burden on your group and help everyone in your group to complete the race and complete all your obstacles within time. FRIEND I GOT RECOMMEND FROM 17 SSB BANGALORE AND I HOPE THIS WILL HELP YOU FOR CLEARING SSB.

Well , here I am trying to give my point of view about each and every test being conducted at the ssb’s based on my experience with 2. I will make it clear that it is just my own point of view, nothing much. I am not trying to be BABA or give guidance. I might be wrong with certain perceptions and corrections are healthily welcomed!! So avoid judging the content from an assessor’s point of view.  Well first thing I made clear was, to be an officer. Be like one. Behave like one. (Not in the sense of being someone else. But a person who Stands up for things)Starting off with the screening process.  OIR : Extremely important. I have heard people saying that OIR isn’t taken into consideration and all. But these marks you score are there on each and every paper which is utilized to judge. Right from PIQ to the main mark sheet’s (being used by Army Boards). All of them carry these marks.  It gives a slight idea of the level of intelligence of candidate. Practice with normal verbal non-verbal books and past questions of CAT paper or RS AGARWAL. Always try to score good in these. Best thing one can do to make it fast is not to waste time on questions you cannot solve instantaneously.  PPDT : Writing : Usually the pictures being shown are hazy(AFSB) . This just brings more versatility in the level of stories being written by a candidate. Chose problems in and around the society and build up something on it. Its just a matter of imagination. The more we relate to the things around us. The easier it becomes to write a story. I see people bringing army officers into the scene and making it complex. I would prefer adhering to a common citizen. Unnecessarily bringing the army in between (when no one in uniform is shown)  and thinking that this might impress the assessor is a myth.Narration : Usually they don’t give that one minute, but when they give us time. They are least bothered in knowing how happy you are after being given the opportunity to speak , your parents name and such typical bullshit (no offense but such formalities just kill ones time and chances). Prefer avoiding hand gestures, shows lack of confidence over words and own speech. Just start with the characters and story thereon. Crisp and clear. Make sure that you are properly conveying my thoughts when made to sit in group of X people. Ample opportunity is provided to narrate and one should make sure you utilize every shit out of it. I never tried to get into the fish market. Believe me. If your story carries sense then you will not have to work much hard to make it the common story of group. Though we couldn’t conclude I was happy that my point of view was considered by the group and was glad that I avoided the fish market( that helps a lot).    Psych : Though being a very deep process I would stick to some basic things I adopted. Practice is the key if you know what type of sentences are to be made. I will not give any examples in this case. One fact we should have in mind while dealing with psych is that ,the person demands our point of view. Just making sentences won’t help. People say that I attempted everything in psych, Without knowing the quality of sentences and responses given. Number will not matter (unless it is below a certain threshold of minimum requirement). Every word given to us is to know our point of view or to say stimulus regarding that. I made sure that what I write expresses what I think about that very matter or subject given to me. In WAT , Including the word doesn’t matter. Write whatever related comes to your mind when you see the word.In TAT ,I adopted the same approach as PPDT. Made a story around a problem and solved it. But I made sure that m not killing anyone or brining unwanted negativity into the pic when it is not even shown. Never award yourselves with anything. Be a selfless man who takes up responsibilities and has a positive outlook. SRT : These people out there give us the most negative situation they could image but I kept in mind that I am not supposed to look at it with even a quite sense of negativity. Every situation given in the booklet points towards a certain OLQ. Well that would be too complex to decode for a normal aspirant. Do not behave like a coward and take up the job to solve the problems. In case of any ambiguous situation, responding in a positive way instead of taking mind to the negative side is a better option. SD : I wrote what came to my mind. But make sure you prepare it before hand. They don’t give much time to sit and think then write.Thanks to the people around me, I am blessed with the best buddies anyone could have had and their exists very less of negativity in my life. A healthy criticism with lots of fun. Yes. Our day to day life impacts a lot on what we write out here in these responses. Instead of trying to give artificial responses. If someone tries  to make their day to day life more productive and surround themselves with aspiring minds. M sure they will end up making a positive impact over the psychologist. So instead of wasting time over memorizing stuff. Make sure your day to day activities are productive. That sounds too philosophical but believe me friends. It aint hard. Channelize your energy and things will fall at the perfect places for you.  GTO :    SELFLESS ATTITUDE  There is a reason we are put into a team. Everything , every way of testing has a reason behind it. I see many people becoming too selfish with their approach and try to dominate the group . I had one thing in mind. Something that I learnt from Band of Brothers. A leader doesn’t lead his troops from the front. He stays behind the troops and pushes the whole troops company forward. Make sure that you don’t have a dominant approach. But also don’t get vanished among the group. Your  presence should be felt with your ideas and not with your physical being. I see people snatching balli and fatta from each other and trying to always stay ahead. It never helps. What helps is that your ideas are pushing the group forward or not. I was lucky that each and every member I had in my group was so good . No one dominated no one contradicted. Remember, contradicting is sensible only when you are speaking facts. When you are speaking ideas, No one is wrong, no one is right. Just the ideas are better.But when you speak, make sure that what you speak is sense and has an impact over the people you are talking to, others are able to understand what is in your mind. That’s it. Even in the GPE . No harm if you  did not conclude. Keep calm in GPE and listen to ideas. Don’t be dominant. Their will be people who will show desperation and domination. Don’t worry. Such chaps help you get noticed. Because they ruin their own chances by such unhealthy habits.  IO (My experience) : Totally personal with a crisp of GK and your Subject concern. Expose yourself only to a certain limit that gives the other person an idea about you. Some get too casual. At times it helps, at times it doesn’t . There is a lot of uncertainty when it comes to exposing yourself . I have very less idea about it. I just made sure that the IO has a good idea about the person I am .  I just made sure I was able to defend certain things like marks and all. Rest I had no grey areas . So Interview went smooth.  My first answer to the IO’ s First question was “DON’T KNOW SIR”. So don’t hesitate the same in case of ambiguity. Don’t opt for bluffing. Rest the Process is totally uncertain. Unexpected heads can stand up after the conference and some expected ones stay behind. Just make sure that each time you leave that place you are better person and an inspired soul who looks ahead for nothing but improvement. There are no hard and fast rules. Just make sure your day to day life is productive and good. Everything will fall at their place.  Always remember. You had make it 80 % when you dreamt of being a soldier.  Rest 20% is sheer hardwork and luck .   make sure you enjoy your stay and make memories.Thanks to my group mates Chandan , Mungee, Atul, Prashant, KP reddy,Pupu, Mithun.  More than anything else I remember the wonderful company of these people I had around. Kudos to the aspirants. You are no normal souls. “ Its not about the end , Its about the journey”

I cleared the SSB in my first attempt for the post of Observer (Indian Navy) at 12 SSB. Although I wasn’t expecting to be recommended, I did learn a lot. Be enthusiastic - whether you are recommended or not, the SSB is going to be fun. You will have time to visit the city, make new friends and apply yourself in new and imaginative ways. You will work with a team to reach the end of an obstacle course with nothing but a pole and a rope. You will race against teams and plan against invasions. You will conclude, with your team, the solution to India’s many problems. Add to this adventure the wondeful staff at SSB. All of this surely made me leave my competitive tips and tricks at the gate, and instead I was filled with motivation to get through to the next day of adventure. Enthusiastic and motivated candidates are also the life of the group being selected, which shows naturally in tasks.Be determined - To think up of a solution on your feet is no small task. Many of us fail to do so. However, this is an important quality that is assessed in SSB via group tasks. Try your very best. Work with your team, measure distances with your resources, ask the GTO/ IO again and again, know the strengths of your team members (such as the lightest person can easily cross a crude drawbridge) and use it appropriately. In group discussions, be consistent and add to the group via your ideas. Sometimes, if you do not have anything to add to the group, you may act as a timekeeper by reminding the group the time left, you may encourage the shy ones to speak up, and even conclude the gd if you pay enough attention. Even if you fail to do so, when you go back to your barracks make sure you know what went wrong and what could be done to get a solution. At the end of the day, make sure your presence counted.Identify the good in you - the SSB is a leadership test and many of us are told to act as leaders to crack SSB. Please don’t do so. Simply identify the good qualities in you and apply them IF you have the opportunity to do so. If you do not get an opportunity, then do not show off unnecessarily.Please do note that this is YOU identifying your own qualities. Make it personal and accurate. Don’t say general and common qualities such as : hardworking, sincere etc; Unless of course you can back it up with a personal story and/or do show these qualities in real life.It happens quite often that people wrongly identify some qualities as “good”. For example, a recommended friend of mine had identified herself to be a good orator. However, she would cut everyone else in any group discussion. Luckily, she noticed her bad habit of cutting down people masquerading as good oratory skills and didn’t do so in the further rounds. This brings me to my next point.Be willing to change - over the course of 5 days you shall adapt to the routine and discipline of the SSB. You shall also learn a lot about yourself. On the conference day the officers expect you to share what you have learnt. A candidate that has learned from his mistakes and has changed for the better has a very good chance of being recommended. One can do so by self analysis.Lastly, be honest. If you are asked a tough question where you feel that lying will be a better way out, just stop and think to yourself for a minute. Ask yourself why you would prefer to lie. Is it the competition? Is it because you failed to do something? When you have the answer, tell the officer the truth as well as the reason above. Leave the rest to the officer to judge. As it is, SSB assessors are trained to spot lies. In fact, it is likely that the assessors know you better than you know yourself.A few funny stories from my ssb: A recommended candidate’s answer to “what is your best quality?” was that she could eat lots of chicken in a short timeA candidate’s answer to “why don’t you have a girfriend?” was a prompt “sir, if you say so I will make one now”The uncountable times candidates have fallen over (in a tom and jerry kind of way) on obstacle courses.

I will tell you how I prepared for the SSB. I did these things: Deactivated my account from facebook because I noticed that I'm wasting too much time on it so i decided to stop using it.Preparation for psychological testStarted preparing for psychological test. I used to prepare from the practice sessions from youtube and then i checked my answers and do improve myself. This was for TAT, WAT and SRT. For the self description i used to write it one the paper and then again same thing just read it many times to find out mistakes and this also helped me to make my SD original. 3. Preparation for interview: I took my notebook and started writing down every question which I thought IO can ask me. Then after writing the questions I started to think of the appropriate answers. And also practice by sitting in front of mirror to speak confidently. I also practiced for being natural to my answers. 4. Preparation for GTO: For GD I read about current topics from quora and for lecture I practiced on different topics in front of mirror. For other GTO tasks I prepared from youtube by seeing videos for group tasks. To do these things I used to prepare for my interview for about 20 minutes daily and after that I used to prepare for my lecture in front of mirror. And for reading anytime when I'm free amd for psychological test I used to do it in morning. So that's how I practiced. Just prepare properly and give your best… Success awaits you ;) All the best!

#1 - Be yourself. And this is all they want from your side.Try to fake something and you are gone. Do what you feel like doing, write what you think, speak as you generally speak. Game can be easily yours.#2 - SSB is never a competition. Don't ever get yourself into competing with fellow aspirants. Don't copy them. Don't bully them. And do not extra ordinarily try to be the leader of all. But be friends with everyone. Work as a team. Even if people are not worthy, don't be like them. Try to come up as a true soldier in physical tasks. You won't be able to do each and everything but the temperament and dedication to try your best must be there. #3 - Go out in the city during the stay. They ask you what did you do in the free time. #4 - In personal interview, be as frank and cheerful as possible. Talk to them as if you are talking to a very good friend. Answer to their questions in details. Just speak out everything. Even about your nasty deeds, if you have done some, but again in a positive way. #5 - About stories in TAT, be logical, and creative. And they don't see beauty of expression. They are not recruiting writers. They want good ideas and action-packed, goal-focussed stories from you. And if, the three officers say the same thing about you, about your OLQs, or they do not find you a fake, in other words, you are almost in. :)  #6 - Cover up some recent and general issues. They would like to know your opinions about things, not mere facts and figures. And as opinions have no measure, just present yours along with proper logic and in a healthy way. May be that's all I have to tell. I loved those 5 days of my life. For any specific query, follow up in comments. Will try and help you.

The selection process at the SSB requires ordinary people ‘like you and me’, who, when the need arises, can perform extra-ordinary feats.  Armed forces are the ONLY profession where we lead our men undo death........ We live by chance, love by choice, and kill by profession. Hence, the forces require officers who display unparallel mettle, quick wit, soldierly demeanour, dogged determination and intense social intelligence that clearly sets them apart from their fellow humans. The SSB process is a very dynamic evaluation of your “projected personality” and “group effectiveness.” Hence, the preparation for the same, unlike any other academic exam, requires an ongoing effort. Please go through the under mentioned “Ten Commandments” that I have written from my experience. Please try to incorporate these in your day to day life so that you can mould yourself to be the person that the SSB is looking for: 1. Consciously decide to follow a strict daily routine to bring about discipline in your lifestyle. The routine must include physical exercising, grooming & looking after your personal hygiene. Also, ensure that you take out time to improve your awareness level by keeping abreast with the current topics of common interest happening in your sphere. Being well-informed and well-spoken creates a visible halo of confidence around you. Always remember that “knowledge is the clay that truly casts your personality”. 2. Develop a habit of judicious time management so that you can be more productive on a daily basis. You must understand the importance of prioritising your daily schedule, so that the things that, “ ‘must’ be done, ‘should’ be done and ‘could’ be done”, in your routine are clearly defined in your mind. 3. Think ahead and have a good foresight to anticipate and prepare yourself appropriately for the forthcoming events rather than getting surprised. This exercise will also help in a major way to reduce stress in your life. 4. Improve your focus by being more observant of whatever is going on around your immediate sphere of activities, some of these interesting activities and experiences can actually become valuable inputs for your psychology tests, like TAT, SRT and SD. 5. Learn to be happy, warm and ‘live in abundance’ so that you charm others around you. Be sensitive to others and respect their space.Be a lot more interactive and participate in healthy discussion on issues of common interest rather than discussing people. Remember; “Small minds discuss people, average minds discuss events, great minds discuss ideas and greatest minds act in silence”. 6. Do some creative writing everyday to improve your expression and flow of thoughts. Perhaps you could pen down interesting events or memories from your past or perhaps even start ‘diary writing’. This exercise will help you improve your flow of thoughts and expression while participating in interactive activities and writing your psychological tests. 7. Identify, short term (up to 5-7 weeks), medium term (6-8 months) and long term (5-7 years) realistic goals for yourself that are within your capacity. Prepare a well thought through action plan and work relentlessly to achieve them. 8. Develop a habit of never leaving anything half-way. Make considered commitments and then ensure you live up to them. 9. Make a conscious effort to interact on a daily basis with your parent, elders and siblings. Learn to live in harmony with your ambient environment, be patient, loving, caring and respectful. The blessings of elders are the foundation on which the very edifice of your life exists. 10. Spare some time daily to introspect upon the day gone by, so that you can strive to continuously improve upon your thoughts and actions so as to become a more accomplished person. The qualities desired of a ‘potential officer’ by the SSB, called the OLQs, are not some mysterious traits that God has given only to a selected few. These are qualities that every responsible citizen and self respecting human being possesses........you only need to polish some of these latent qualities that are lying dormant in you through conscientious effort by following the above stated “Ten Commandments”. Finally, clearing the SSB will just be a by-product of your efforts to improve your overall projected personality. So, realign your basic approach towards preparation for SSB...........believe-me, it is much less complex than what some people have made it to be.

Greetings Mam. It appears that you have to go to SSB and want to prepare for it. First of all I would like to say that, SSB is the test of one’s personality. You can;t change your personality for this interview. Your real self will ultimately come out in SSB, however you can enhance yourself. Regarding training for SSB, it depends whether you have considerable time left or in a haste, whatever may be your case but there are some things that you can do to prepare for SSB 1.Please visit SSBcrack.com, it’s the best SSB preparation website(I use it too!) 2.Read newspaper daily and be abreast with current affairs( I prefer Hindu and The Indian Express) 3.Purchase a good SSB book and follow the procedure,practice tests like WAT,SRT,TAT etc (Arihant/SSBcrack) 4.Improve your communication skills, speak up in formal occasions, give lectures and if you don’t have that kind of atmosphere just prepare a talk for yourself. 5.Enhance your behavior, try to inculcate the Officer Like Qualities or the OLQ’s. 6. Be proactive and Self Introspect. (It’s easier said than done!) 7. Try to overcome your shortcomings and conquer them slowly. 8.Practice verbal and Non-Verbal Intelligence test.(Required for Stage I in SSB) 9. Improve your body language by any way you find effective and please have a lot of SELF-CONFIDENCE.(That’s the most important virtue) 10. In the end the most important point for SSB. Never ever Lie in SSB, so start to extract that from your life from now onward so that by the time you give SSB you don’t say anything but the Truth. Having said all that, I myself am appearing for SSB for the first time in a few months.(NDA II 2016) I hope it helps. JAI HIND.

Ok, I would suggest you a few of the tips which I followed for 1 month before my SSB. 1- Followed a disciplined life 2- Used to run 2.4km everyday in the evening. 3-Watched motivational videos with insightful thoughts. 4-Was regular to a few of the self help books. Robin Sharma and Shiv Khera were my favourite then. 5-Used to communicate with people with the same level of motivation. In my case it was my uncle who was equally enthusiastic about me attending the interview. 6-Practiced regularly about my interview and Screening test. 7 Used to think positively about everything. 8- Watched Times Now programme Newshour by Arnab, but today I would suggest you to watch BBC or CNN. Refrain from watching any populist news channel. 9-was regular to 3 news papers. THE HINDU, HINDUSTAN TIMES, DELHI TIMES. Skip political or biased perspectives. I never read about Modi or Rahul Gandhi, the two hotshots then. Refrained from talking about any individual, but the underlying reason and cause of the issues. 10- Dreamt, Talked and Spoke as if I was going to clinch the moon. And I did that.  This is me in Allahabad PVR during the interview. So, I enjoyed a lot during the interview as well. I was recommended, featuring in the merit list at 214th rank.

1 KNOW SSB’S TESTS AND PROCEDURES INSIDE OUT Try to learn more about the procedures that you’ll face once you reach there. There will be a series of tests conducted across several days. Make sure that you get proper knowledge about the time-table. Learn more details about the various tests you’ll face. Initially, there will be a screening test. Those who manage to clear the screening test and group discussion round are then supposed to stay at the SSB centre for the next 5-6 days. Over these 5-6 days, various tests and interviews will be conducted by the board. Personal Interview is also held during this phase. Apart from PI, some other tests are also held. Some of those tests are- SRT, WAT, Progressive Group Task, Final Group Task, Command Task, Physical Testand Conference round. These tests will come one after another from the second day onward. Though the CHM will inform you about the timing and dates regarding these tests, it is always better to do one’s homework and be prepared to face them anytime! Know what tests like WAT (Word Association Test), SRT (Situation Reaction Test) etc are all about. Know when you’ll face such tests, what these tests are all about etc. This is the most important tip. 2 AFTER FOLLOWING TIP NO 1, DO GOOD PRACTICE AND FORM TEST-WISE PREPARATION HABITS Okay, I hope that you’ll follow tip 1 religiously. After doing that, make sure that you go on a quality ‘practice session’. Knowing these tests closer is key part, but practicing them is even more better. Study materials are available in abundance. You may go for ‘coaching classes’, buy CDS and NDA preparation books or get study material online! Whatever source you choose, make sure that you practice well. It is very important to prepare for each test/stage involved in the SSB Interview. Each test has its own unique nature. Forming test-wise preparation habits will definitely be of help. SRT, WAT and similar written tests can be dealt with by practicing from study material available in the market. Going through question sets will help you get a grip, when it comes to such tests. But it is difficult to prepare for Group Tasks, PI, Physical Test round and Conference round merely by referring books and study material. When it comes to Group Task, one must have confidence, clear thinking, analytical skills, decision making skills and good communication skills to perform well! Developing those traits will definitely help one out! Being physically fit and agile will help during the Physical test stage. There’s a set of fixed obstacles, when it comes to this round. Having knowledge about these obstacles and training keeping them in mind will help you during the actual test. Time saving tactics can be used during this stage and bonus marks can be obtained by one! PI is a tricky affair. One must be very confident, prepared and honest, when it comes to this stage. Adequate importance must be given to dressing and appearance, sitting posture, physical gestures and eye contact. Don’t get too nervous, try to stay calm and answer the interviewer’s questions honestly. Keep answers to the point. Honesty is the best policy. Filling up the PIQ form honestly and correctly will ensure that you won’t face ‘tricky situations’ during the interview. During the PI, interviewer will look for key traits like OLQs, confidence, decision making skills, analytic skills, general awareness and aptitude. 3 DON’T IGNORE CURRENT AFFAIRS This is what many candidates ignore. They’ll practice for all those tests, but leave behind Current Affairs. Having good general awareness and knowledge of current affairs is an added advantage! Many times, during the personal interview stage, questions related to current affairs will be posed by the interviewer. Make sure that you go through NEWS Papers, NEWS headlines etc daily. Also referring magazines like Pratiyogita Darpanand sites like Jagran Josh will help you. 4 SOME THINGS YOU SHOULD HAVE DETAILED KNOWLEDGE ABOUT- All SSB interviews emphasize on some common topics. These common topics are- India, Indian Politics, History of India, India and its current affairs, Armed Forces in Indiaetc. Questions about these topics are almost always asked during personal interviews, group discussion etc. Make sure that you read and study these topics extensively. Preparing and keeping your own ‘notes’ will help. With the use of internet, you may get all the necessary knowledge for free! 5 BRUSH UP YOUR TECHNICAL/ ACADEMIC KNOWLEDGE Doing so will come handy during the personal interview. Many times, interviewers go for such technical questions. If you are a 12th standardpassed/appearing student, the interviewer may ask questions related to your studies. For example, I was asked this question- ‘What is Bernoulli’s equation?’. If you are an engineering graduate, then prepare for similar questions related to your branch. So, brushing up your knowledge is essential. 6 KNOW YOUR NATIVE STATE/TOWN BETTER Having good, detailed knowledge about your home state or town is good. Questions related to them are often asked during personal interview. Before the personal interview, candidates are asked to fill a PIQ (Personal Information Questionnaire). Details like state, town etc of the candidate must be filled. So, it is obvious that the interviewer will pose some questions related to them. Collect information related to current affairs, historical significance, population, language, governmental organizations, notable personalities etc of your state/town. 7 BE AWARE OF THE TOUGH CLIMATE; PRACTICE TIME MANAGEMENT ACCORDINGLY Usually, the interviews are held at time, when the climate is extreme. For example, consider the SSB interview held at Allahabad in January. At that time, the place would be too cold. It is essential to know the climatic conditions early on and practice accordingly. In January cold, at Allahabad, you won’t be able to write fast because of ‘cold and frozen’ hands!  And let me remind you that ‘writing fast’ is necessary to do well in tests like WAT, TAT, SRT etc. So, writing practice, keeping the climate in mind often helps. Take time to form some ‘time management’ strategies. 8 BE HONEST, SIMPLE AND ‘BE YOURSELF’ Having these traits will help you greatly during personal interview and the whole SSB thing. Be honest while filling out PIQ form. Don’t brag about things you never did! Bragging and lying will come back to haunt you during interview! Don’t try to act smart. Be your normal self. Acting like somebody else will do more harm than good. 9 CULTIVATE CONFIDENCE, IMPROVE ORATORY SKILLS This is something you definitely should do. Building confidence will certainly help you perform well in personal interview, group discussion, group task etc. Having good oratory skills will also help during group discussion, group task etc. Invest some time daily cultivating these qualities in yourself. You’ll be amazed by the return it’ll give! 10 MAINTAIN GOOD PHYSICAL FITNESS Okay, let’s not ignore this aspect. There is a whole ‘obstacles round’, where your physical prowess will be put to test! So, maintain a basic level of fitness and physique. Exercise regularly, eat well, eat good food. The obstacle course is a real ‘bonus round’. You can score high score if you’re in good shape and have good fitness level. These are the top 10 tips that I wanted to share with you guys. I believe that religiously practicing and implementing these tips will help you crack SSB interview! While you appear for it, treat others like your friends, enjoy your stay there and give it your best shot! You’ll learn a lotduring your stay there.

For SSB you have to be serious from the day one. Start your physical toughening process by going for run and exercise in the morning. Build up your stamina. From SSB guide you will come to know about the physical tests conducted by the GTO. prepare accordingly. Read the news papers regularly. Read current affairs and remain up to date. Both national and international events are essential, development in science and technology is of importance. If possible practice group discussion with your friends . Do not dominate the group discussion nor remain shy, participate in the discussion by giving your free and frank views. Play group games like volleyball, football , kabadi, cricket with your friends on regular basis. Which ever game you play know those rules and regulations well. Identify and know some thing about the champions of those games. Develop your reading habits.Read couple of books/novels /fictions and know the theme of that .know some thing about that author. Your family is your closest friend. Spend time with them. Help them in day to day work . Participate in all family afire like puja, celebration ,marriage etc so that you can meet different people and interact with them.Know your family background and be proud of them. Sit down and introspect, which are your strong points and which are your week points. Stablise and hold on to your strong points, try and develop your week areas. Your friends and teachers can guide you in this regard. Be Positive, Be helpful towards other, Be a group man, Be a leader, Be tough, Have courage to say no when things are not right, Be confident. With all the above you will metamorphosis to a gentleman. This is when your friends and colleagues will accept you as a leader. If that happens,then you are on track to face the SSB. Above all have faith on Almighty, seek his blessings to clear all hurdles of life. Best of Luck.

SSB is a test of personality and so no amount of cramming answer for psychology test or copying someone else personality is going to help you. You need to build your own personality and personality is developed by bringing changes in your day to day life. The most important thing to clear SSB is to know yourself inside out. Strengths, weakness, likes, dislikes, everything there is about you! Being yourself is important. Trying to show-off or giving false details when asked is not at all appreciated. The officers are experienced assessors and know the difference between a genuine gentleman and a show-off. Bluffing or giving vague replies is a big NO! I would also suggest knowing the testing procedure and what the tests are designed to check. Also a sound knowledge of the organisation is required (Army, Navy, or Air Force). Also pick up a sport (preferably a team one) to build co-ordination and team spirit in you and get healthy at the same time. Now coming to Your Question I will advice you to focus on your Fitness, English, General Awareness and most importantly become a doer, observer and a social person in addition to it do following things. Fitness: Make yourself physically very fit. Run as much as you can and also join gym if you have time and money for it.English:Speak to yourself in English, Speak with your friend in English and watch English news channelsWrite diary on daily basis to remove spelling mistakes and to propel your observing skillsLogical Reasoning: Practice logical reasoning from books.News Paper: Read newspaper on daily basis.GK: Have good knowledge about India and India’s relations with neighboring countries and major world powers.Sports: Participate in sports as much as you can to a level that you are able to represent school/college team in at least one sport.Extra-curricular Activities: Actively participate in extra-curricular activities and organizing events in school/college.Main Subjects : Have sufficient knowledge of your main subjects that you have studied till now.At last become a good human being and help others as much as you can.Thanks for reading. Cheers Peace and Love.

Following can be done to prepare yourself for SSB Interview: General Knowledge: Do you have good General knowledge? If not, Prepare well in advance as it will help you in Lecturrette and GD. Have brief knowledge of Important International Organisation viz. WTO, UNO, SAARC, ASEAN, World Bank, BIMSTEC, Events related to National Interests, Global Issues and social issuea like Women Empowerment Dowry System, Child abuse, Child Labour, Right to Education, Unemployment in India etc.Psychological Test: Purchase any good SSB Book.Practice a lot for SRT, WAT, TAT and SD.Keep checking your sentences and try to cut them short. Keep them simple and action oriented.Check your timing. Keep ready your mobile stopwatch and try to finish within stipulated time.GTO Task: Do some physical excercises daily to keep yourself fit and ready for SSB.Do minimum 30 squat, 30 push ups and 25 shit ups daily and practice 10 mtr rope climbing.Start reading a news paper infront of a mirror to enhance your confidence for public speaking. Do some pre- SSB reserach about current topics and their significance.See your body language while reading and observe yourself. Your face and eyes must be normal and free of any stress.Start practicing with any of your friend ( if possible), if not do yourself assuming your audience in front of you.Personal Interview: Know yourself. This is most important as none but you know yourself. What are your hobbies? What are your strengthes? What are your weaknesses? What does your father do? Why did you get low marks in your 10/12 (Never blame your teacher or illness for this)?Know about your habits ( bad and good both). Improve upon your bad habits and weaknesses. Cultivate some good habits.Try to express yourself. Narrate series of events and important points. Communicate effectively and convey your message in polite manner.Don't argue with IO and other members. They are enough smart to judge you.Say sorry or Pardon me Sir in case you couldn't understand question.Don't mug up any story to hide something. Be honest. Accept your mistakes committed in your teen age.Look straight and keep eye contact with all the Board members. Don't look down. Be simple and genuine. They want to know the real you.Hope it helps. Good luck.

SSB is something which test you holistically. There are some traits which are important to keep in mind. SSB is very different from all other selection procedures as they select one among 100 in SSB though different tests. Few important things which they test are Confidence ( at all levels , GTO through tasks, Psychologists through SRT n WAT, Interview through Qs.Courage ( Physical n mental)Positive attitude for weaker section ( Required to deal with subordinates in service as an officer)Quick decisions through different tests.Capability to work under pressureThese are the things which are tested through all tests and must be recommended by all three assessors for recommendation to be cleared. Any doubt in any trait is tested/confirmed in conference through various Qs. Now about your Q on how to prepare on daily basis… Devote your time on developing of these qualities rather than giving individual focus on IO, GTO or Psy…. Prepare your PIQ and get it evaluated from someone as this will be the base for your interview . For ex if you write football as your hobby …..he may ask you why India is not in top 50 teams of world…like that.For every Ground Testing ….. certain OLQs are tested in each test ….prepare at least 3 or 4 OLQ for each tasks and you should show these in each test…most Imp, GTO should notice you…For almost all Psych tests this is not mandatory to complete all papers ..for ex if 60 words are given in WAT…its important to write positive sentences rather than focusing on completing max Qs. If you attempt only 40 with better ans ,you will go through ….You should learn art of persuasion ,,, it is very important ….. you must thank each individual in front of assessor and thank assessor too after each test…..you should use your communication skills to make good friends at SSB which helps in various tasks indirectly ….You should praise defence forces for whatever reason …as you are going to join the same ….it must be felt by all assessors that you are dedicated to join the same …I remember one candidate who was also outstanding but he gave civil services preference over defence in interview n conference …obviously he was not selected due to lack of interest towards defence.All the best …… Enjoy you training ( The most imp part of service career.) u can mail me specific queries if any on amanchoudhary005@gmail.com

I got recommended from 12 SSB Bangalore for Indian Navy, to crack SSB you need to prepare yourself mentally and physically. All SSB's look for officer like qualities (OLQ) in an individual, and if the candidate displays them to SSB he's through. The OLQs are Effective Intelligence.Reasoning Ability.Power of Expression.Self Confidence.Determination.Organizing Ability.Initiative.Courage.Cooperation.Sense of Responsibility.Stamina.Group Influencing Ability.Liveliness.Social Adaptability.Speed of DecisionApart from these, they also check if you are up to date about the current affairs of India and the world. At times during interview they also check your presence of mind Eg- My friend got recommended for army, for him during the interview they asked, “How can you prove to me that this room is the shape of a square without measuring it” for this he answered by saying “ Tiles in this room are square, so if the no of tiles in this room fit exactly we can say that room is the shape of square” and he got recommended. So these are some things which you need to keep in mind if you want to clear SSB.

I feel that the asking person wants to join the armed forces, my brief answer will certainly help. After 7 attempts, I was recommended. My strategy was this, There are 15 olq's, one can find it in internet. And the details of SSB are also available there, so get the sample TAT, SAT, WAT's, and answer them accordingly. PLEASE DO NOT FOLLOW OTHERS ANSWER S. Get a sample piq paper too. Fill it. Now, think about the psychology paper, you might have done something which is not expected from a cadet (provided wrong/ bad response). Correct them. You wrote in the SRT that, you give him some clothes you have, some food and money ( this is what I did). Follow that in real life. You will see, that all your SRT, WAT, TAT will go well. Even you don't have to mug the answer for interview or psych test. You attitude towards life will improve which will be reflected in the selection process. Don't give an excuse. Give priority to proper tasking so you don't have to regret in future. Once an officer said to me, that forces want cadets having a good balance between heart, guts and intelligence… follow that. Always have a good reason, why to join army/navy/air force. You need proper enthusiasm for that. Follow war heroes stories. What can I say more.. Good luck. Make your nation proud. Jai Hind. Please make any other appropriate suggestions, we all will be grateful to that. Thanks in advance.

I will share my own experience which finally helped me to get recommend from 21SSB Bhopal in the very first attempt. 1 .Always remember it is never too late to start a new thing . When I was a junior cadet in my school , I was weak in English communication and always had stage fear but one day my father told me about its importance in SSB(my father could not clear his ssb twice when he was in Sainik School Rewa).This motivation helped me to participate in stage activities and challenge myself and finally now I have an upper hand . So,first thing is work on ur communication part and it will show how confident you are in ssb. 2.Always get yourself aware about the happenings of the world ( read newspaper ,practice extempore on different topics). 3.Practice story making ,sentence formation from different words,(start diary entry and write down important events of your life becz in TAT,WAT you can easily write your own experience which is realistic within given time.I mean writing down any imaginary story will be unrealistic sometimes and will take more time unlike your own life story . 3. For interview,you must know everything about yourself(like hobby, achievements,etc).so for that take a print out of a sample of PIQ form and fill it and make out what all questions could be asked becz the interviewer has your PIQ placed on his table and he ask everything based on what you have written in your PIQ. 4.Now for the practice of interview you can take help of any friend or teacher to take your interview.How? Firstly fill the PIQ and give that to your interviewer and tell him to ask questions based on it ,and do it seriously (I too had done the same and trust me you will see great improvement in your presentation and confidence). 5.For GTO task ,trust me it is not a big deal until and unless you keep your mind open ( obstacles are very simple) and remember the colour rules and don't break those while performing task.The GTO only looks how confident you are, your contribution to the group(work for your group and be a good leader ),be full with Josh. 6.lastly few things you must keep in mind in ur ssb : Be confident and optimistic ( think that you will make it through ssb ( I mean it seriously)) Learn from your mistakes and focus on upcoming event(don't worry about what has happened) For above point ,I will tell u my own experience about interview where I couldn't answer few questions,I felt tensed but one of my group mate told me very simple but exact thing that 'jo ho gya wo ho gya aage ke task pe dhyan de aur uspe focus kar'.This simply helped me a lot . Be truthful,have good dressing sense ,talk confidently. Maintain the Josh in every task ,be a good listener to be a good leader,then only ur companion will pay attention to u back. And You must enjoy your 5 golden days ,make friends as much u can make ,and just keep the momentum. All the best and rock the show.
