You can begin with first of all changing your words and your outlook towards life. Going by your sentence, I'd like to point that you cannot train yourself for SSB Interview. You can only develop your personality, as there are no fixed standards. SSB is not a 100m race which you need to complete in 10 or 12 seconds, or whatever your target might be. SSB is going out and being your best everyday. It is about giving your 100 percent to everything that you do, and accepting the ones you don't. It is about having enough faith in self to be able to know your strengths and weaknesses and taking steps towards working on them. The best way to prepare for SSB is acquiring knowledge. And by knowledge, I don't mean merely general awareness. Know yourself well, know the SSB process well, know the place you belong to well, know the people you live with well and also, know the factors that affect all these things. Once you begin with acquiring knowledge of these things, start working on yourself. Evolve daily. At the end of the day, make a brief outline of your day and see which areas you lacked in and in which you did exceptionally well. Set your own standards. It is always good to know the experiences of others but don't let it wash away your originality. That is the biggest concern, if any, for SSB.

The SSB interview is a crucial hurdle which candidates have to clear during the selection process. Showcasing a confident personality, ready with and presence of mind is a prerequisite for clearing the interview. It is very essential that the candidates work on developing certain qualities which will help them to showcase themselves in the best possible manner at the interview. Here are the TOP 7 TIPS which Candidates can follow to bring out the Brighter Side of their Personalities at the SSB Interview. Self Analysis: A good way of analyzing one’s own self is by maintaining a diary. Candidates can keep a record of their feelings, their objectives and ambitions. Setting certain deadlines for achievement is also a good idea. They can then keep track of their achievements from time to time.Socializing: One of the primary qualities which the IO looks for in a candidate at the SSB Interview is his ability to socialize and adapt to various social circumstances. Hence, all candidates should try and enhance their ability to socialise and deal with different kinds of situations.SWOT Analysis: The SWOT (Strength, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats) analysis is something which all SSB Interview candidates should do. Although a complete analysis could take quite some time; doing it is totally worth it. Candidates can get a clear picture about their strength areas and their weaknesses. They can make further improvements based on the results.Develop good speaking and listening skills: Having a good command over English is very essential for SSB Interview candidates. Good English speaking skills surely help candidates fetch brownie points at the interview. It enables candidates to communicate their thoughts effectively. Reading newspapers, books and engaging in English conversation can prove very helpful.Being a good listener is also very important. Hence, candidates should listen carefully and be more attentive and alert. Have a positive attitude: Candidates should maintain a positive attitude throughout. Even if they fail, they should be optimistic, learn from their mistakes and try not to repeat them the next time.Compete with your own self: Developing the zeal to compete with one’s own self is very important. Instead of trying to outdo others, one wise thing to do is to compete with one’s own self and bring about a positive change within. Candidates can set standards for improvement and try their best to achieve them. In this way they will be constantly bettering themselves and success will surely be theirs.Johari analysis: This analysis is based on the Johari window which has four quadrants. Each of the quadrants stands for a particular group of qualities. These qualities are the ones known to one’s own self, known to others, unknown to one’s own self and unknown to others. Candidates can ask others to evaluate them and they can get to know about these qualities. This analysis becomes very helpful for the self-description test.These tips to bring about self-improvement will surely help candidates in preparing themselves for the SSB interview. A positive change in their personalities will enable them to face the interview with greater confidence and they will definitely be successful.

There is nothing like - Conference out or Screened out It is always - recommended or not recommended. Simple!!If you don’t get recommended, don’t use other adjectives to fool yourself. Now coming to the preparations. SSB mainly constitutes of 4 parts:Screening: This part covers a candidate’s basic intelligence to ensure that he/she will understand the process ahead and will be able to attempt the tests ahead. If you don’t go through it, one of the major shortcomings is - IQ levels. So, for this section work on IQ levels, presentability and presence of mind. The balance 3 parts are the core area of SSB and aim at seeing if the candidate has necessary OLQs (Officer-like qualities) or is malleable enough to imbibe them. Psychological tests-GTO-Interview collectively check your adaptability and OLQ levels, by a theoretical and practical display and eventually allow you to fill the gaps in the personal interaction. If you notice - the psychological tests are very fast paced which do not allow you to bluff and write things that come very naturally to you. Here there are no marks for attempting as many things as you could, but missing out on some parts will leave gaps in the understanding of the assessor. In simple mathematical terms, if you were to attempt 50 questions and you did 2 wrong and similarly you did 2 wrong out of 30 questions, it appears that in both cases you had 2 mistakes, but the percentage mistake in 2/30 is higher than 2/50 (there is no right or wrong in SSB though). So try and attempt as many as possible in Psychological tests, so that you have more opportunities for sharing different facets of your personality. GTO, although appears outdoors and in sports attire, is not at all physically gruelling activity. It firstly validates what you have told in psychological tests and also gives you an opportunity to practically display things like - leadership, teamwork and initiative, which you have used in multitude during your psychological tests. You are sure to get caught here. It is also to check your demeanour when you have to do public speaking, discussions and present complicated ideas. Your impromptu thinking, general awareness of various issues and above all - conveying ideas in the most uncomplicated way will really work well for you. It again validates the SRT in psychological tests, where you would have displayed how much of an uncomplicated and quick thinker you are. Some outdoor tasks definitely check your physical ability and ability to react to pressure situations. (In my first SSB I hurt myself badly in Tiger leap and could not do any of the further tasks- yet got recommended. It is not the only criteria) The interview allows a more experienced assessor to see you in-person, check on your confidence and body language. However, it also allows you to talk about the things that you might have missed out in other tests due to various reasons. This section has the most human input in your success, GTO and Psychological tests have a more rigid assessment structure. If you have read till here, you would have understood that SSB allows you to WRITE, DISPLAY, SPEAK (monologue, dialogue and discuss) and then assesses you. Reading all the above, you can make your strategy for preparing yourself. There is no set formula for succeeding, but one thing you should be sure of - is yourself. Be truthful to yourself and show yourself the way you are.

First understand the fact that SSB is analysation of your personality. It's not like that you have to prepare for a specific test. Some months ago, I was also finding the answer of such questions but after giving SSB and withdrawing it ( I was screened in, but I withdrawn), I have a good lesson, how to face it ! If you have ever noticed (not just that you ‘know') the pattern of SSB tests (you can find it anywhere), then you should understand that, they do not select a man, who is perfectionist in every task, rather they prefer a man who has similarity in his ‘मनसा वाचा कर्मणा’ that means you must have similarities in whatever you think ,whatever you speak & whatever you do ! You need to be honest on that. The biggest myth about SSB Preparation is that, candidates think like “ Ok, I am good at PPDT, but bad at WAT so I should prepare for WAT” Or “I am doing good at GTO task, but I am facing problem in Lecturettes, I should join a teacher for that” And many more… These thoughts and preparation method is just like “You have a tree, whose leaves are good but stem is not OK, so you think to operate stem, so that it could be better” Is this the practical way, what you do ?? No..! In such case, you will take care of the roots. You will water it on time, put fertilizers and will prepare best for Roots to grow..Because it will ultimately help in enriching whole plant !! That's the same way…you have to enrich yourself by growing roots inside you ! Fill the pockets of your mind with the coins of positiveness, confidence, knowledge & Optimism. Do not try to prepare for a specific task. But you should know, what to do ? How to do..will come from inside and never forget the Mantra given above & you will definitely rock your SSB.

What is SSB? The Service Selection Board (SSB), set up by the Ministry of Defense, undertakes the SSB Interview to evaluate prospective candidates for recruitment in the Army, Navy and Air Force. The benchmarks on which the candidates are assessed include intelligence, personality, compatibility and potential. Hence, mental preparation holds prominence over physical preparation, although physical fitness will be an added advantage. Eligibility Unmarried graduates who clear the Combined Defense Services Examination conducted by the UPSC are selected for the SSB Interview. For males: Born on or after 2 January 1991 and not after 1 January 1996In case of Air force Academy, a person should be born on or after 2 January 1992 and on or before 1st January 1996For females: Born on or after 2 January 1990 and on or before 1 January 1996Unmarried or issueless widowsQualification: NavalAcademy : A bachelor's degree in engineering.AirForceAcademy : A degree in 包商城. with Physics & Mathematics; B.E. and B. Tech.IndianMilitaryAcademyand Officers'TrainingAcademy : Degree or equivalent from a recognised university.Name of the post: After medical checkup and training, the candidates are inducted as Commissioned Officers. Notifications: Candidates are intimated for the SSB interview through call letters. In case call letter is not received on time after clearing the UPSC exam, the candidate must immediately contact the concerned office. Schedule of SSB Examination The five-day personality and intelligence test schedule is as under: Day 1: Basic Intelligence TestDay 2: Psychological TestDay 3 & Day 4: The Group Testing Officers (GTO) ActivitiesDay 5: ConferenceA Personal Interview (PI) can be taken on any day between second to fourth days. Tips to prepare for SSB Exam Reach a day before: Prepare yourself for a five-day schedule of the SSB. You need to reach a day before the first day, when you will be briefed on details of the next five days, code of conduct to be maintained, etc. Be confident: Maintain a confident and positive frame of mind and believe in your capabilities. After all, you've come this far from among thousands of candidates. First day: On the first day of the schedule, basic intelligence and verbal and non-verbal reasoning skills are evaluated. You are asked to see a picture of thirty seconds duration and describe it in a story form. Later, group discussions are held in batches to select the most suitable story. To do well in this section, go through the last few years' question papers to get an idea. Solve papers of different aptitude tests. Get involved in GDs and debates whenever you get time. These will improve your verbal and non-verbal skills. Practice writing & analyzing: Practice writing about anything you see, for instance, the boy playing in the park or the girl on a school bus. Write small stories and monitor your timing. The story should include seven parameters such as sex, mood, age, character, past, present and future of a situation that the character of your story is in. Analyse the story. Things to keep in mind for the GD session: Do not look at the officers while narrating your story and just after completing it.Proper body language should be maintained.Do not argue in the GD; allow others to speak, including the weaker ones.Wait for the right time to put in the strong points of the story that you have written.Try to be actively present in the discussion so that the officers notice you.Second Day: The second day is considered very important. Thematic Appreciation Test (TAT), Word Association Test (WAT), Situation Reaction Test (SRT) and Self Description are undertaken, all of which are part of psychological process. These are all general psychology tests that demand your extensive attention and concentration. Self-description: Prepare for it beforehand. The psychologists usually look for your: Ability to self analyzeAim in life and determinationThinking and mentality regarding parents, family, friends, neighbours, teachers and others.Perception of how your parents, family, friends, neighbours, teachers and others analyse you.Preparations for next two days: The Group Testing Officers (GTO) activities conducted on the third and fourth days include various indoor and outdoor group activities like Group Discussion, Group Obstacle Race, Group Planning and Progressive Group Tasks. The individual tasks consist of Individual Lecturette, Individual Obstacles and Command Tasks. These tests are conducted to evaluate you as a team player in various situations as also as an individual. It also assesses your leadership qualities and the way you express yourself. Perform all the tasks in a calm and composed manner. Personal interview: The officers can take your Personal Interview (PI) on any day between second to fourth days, so be mentally prepared for it. Fifth day: The fifth day generally comprises closing address by the board's Deputy President, conference and announcement of results, followed by dispersal. Personality development: For SSB, it is not important that you should be a highly intelligent person but should be strong, mature and posses a well-developed personality. Keep fit: It is essential to keep fit so that you can conduct all the physical activities with ease. A good heath will also help you to get a clearance in the medical tests. Some Recommended Books SSB Interview: The Complete Guide by Dr. (Cdr.) Natarajan, Arihant PublicationsSSB: What? How? And Why? by J.B. MallModern SSB Interviews by Col. Kuldip S. DosanjhSSB Interviews & Psycho Intelligence Tests by R. Gupta

I've written an answer to this earlier, so simply copy-pasting it here. Before I begin, I just want you to realize that The SSB stands for  Service Selection Board. Nowhere do they mention that it is a  competitive exam (or an exam, for that matter).  The best way, in  my opinion, to prepare for The SSB is to understand yourself as much as  you can. Find out all your positives and negatives and try working on  the latter.  Be as true to yourself as you can. Don't fool  yourself with false or undeserving praise. At the same time, if you've  done something good, remember that.  As far as the tests are concerned, I bought the SSB by Arihant which  is an inexpensive book explaining everything there is. Just read that  book and watch Lakshya and Border and perhaps Saving Private Ryan and  your preparation is done.  Also, if you're not confident in  speakin, especially public speaking, take up as many debates and GDs as  you can. Interact with as many people on as many topics as you can. Not only will this prepare you for the SSB , it'll also make your life a whole lot more interesting. (I actually went a whole month without playing FIFA! )I found that most tests involve interaction and you really make or break your SSB Here!   I  only have the experience of an SSB, so I'm probably not the best person  to answer this, yet, this is what most people I had asked before my SSB  had suggested I do.  Good Luck though :)

Question URL: #quora .com/How-can-I-train-myself-for-SSB-interview. Best tips and tricks for the question: #How can I train myself for SSB interview? TOP 6 JOB INTERVIEW SECRETS: =>1. Tell Your Story You must sell your product, which is yourself, to land the job. Be prepared to tell the interviewer why he should hire you. Some interviewers might not ask you directly to explain why you are the best candidate for the job. Whether you are asked, be sure to fit in a response during the conversation. Be confident and concise in explaining why you believe you should be hired and what you will do the best job possible. Include your qualifications in your sales pitch. Related posts: Top 10 career stories for your job interviews: 10CareerStories.blogspot . com+ Free ebook 33interview questions with answers:InterviewQuestionsAZ.blogspot. com/2018/09/top-33-interview-questions-with-answers.html=>2. Employers want to like you as a person Since they already think you have the skills, and they want to hire you, what are most employers looking for in an interview? Frankly, they want to know if they like you and if you’re going to fit in with the team. Once they hire you, you become someone they will have to see and speak to every day at work. They often end up spending more time with you than they do with their family or friends. So likeability really matters. This is why coming up with clichéd answers to standard questions won’t work. If you say that your biggest flaw is that you’re a ‘perfectionist workaholic,’ the interviewer won’t learn anything about the real you, and may be annoyed by your lack of sincerity. Related post: InterviewQuestionsAZ.blogspot. com/2018/09/32-tips-to-prepare-for-your-job-interviews.html+ 10 secrets to win every job interviews: InterviewQuestionsAZ.blogspot. com/2013/07/top-10-secrets-to-win-every-job.html=>3. Search for former employees. In LinkedIn you can search for past employees and may also find the person who held the job before. Here you will find a rich source of insights, and information regarding the position, the manager, and the corporate culture. Regarding the request, the best way to ask for information is to use something like the following: “I found you on LinkedIn and noticed that your background includes working at ABC. I am interviewing there and wondered if you could answer just a few questions as a random act of kindness. I promise not to take much of your time and thank you in advance.” You can also search your college alumni database to see if anyone worked there. A fellow “alum” is generally more likely to respond to your request than someone with whom you have nothing in common =>4. Structure Your Answer: Most people think of a job interview as a passive experience. The interviewer asks questions, you answer them. Answer them well and confidently and you’ve got a job. Something like that. Instead, think of the interview as a chance for a guided conversation you run on the subject you want to talk about: how you’re going to make a difference to this new organization. Have five points to make and be prepared to give both a quick answer and a longer answer on each of the five points. The longer answers are for follow up questions and comments. =>5. Ask Questions Do not leave the interview without ensuring that you know all that you want to know about the position. Once the interview is over, your chance to have important questions answered has ended. Asking questions also can show that you are interested in the job. Be specific with your questions. Ask about the company and the industry. Avoid asking personal questions of the interviewer and avoid asking questions pertaining to politics, religion and the like. Related post: 12 secrets to make $10k from YouTube channel: YTtricks365.blogspot. com =>6. Use the thank you email to your advantage. If you did fumble something or let nerves get the better of you in part of the interview, the follow-up note can help you clarify a bungled point. If you’re better in writing than chatting in person, a coherent and charming thank you note can help shore up the final impression.

SSB remains the same regardless of the force you want to join. Now coming to your question, there is no exact way to clear SSB ( I prefer calling it ‘getting recommended’). It is a personality test and not a knowledge based interview and for the same reason you cannot mould yourself in a matter of days or months to become fit for the forces. If u really desire to be an army officer, improve yourself as an individual, everyday. Ofcourse there are certain things that should be kept in mind while attending SSB. These are a few of them- 1- Be brutally honest 2- Be crisp no beating around the bush 3- Participate with logic and do not just speak (especially in GD & GPE) for the sake of speaking. 4- In psychology tests, put down your thoughts without worrying what the assessor will make out of it. 5- Do not try to dominate. SSB is not relative, it is absolute. In a nut shell, BE YOURSELF!!!! Good luck :)

Prepare yourself for the SSB just how the SSB assesses you. Psychology Test:Take initiative and responsibility. Develop better understanding. You can empower your strengths and work on your weaknesses. Be more logically imaginative to build constructive ideas to work on. Have the right attitude and foresight.Ground Tasks:Stay selfless. Help others. Stay focused. Strengthen your physical fitness. Take correct and quick actions. Believe in teamwork. Patience is the key in mess. Take calculated risks.Personal Interview: Know yourself. Communicate confidently to express well. Have clarity in mind. Be polite. Be aware / alert of happenings. Absorb positivity in greys.There are numerous ways you can inculcate good qualities in yourself. Identify the ones you already have and work on the required ones. Train yourself for the SSB procedure and practice is the key. Also read abt 15 OLQs Indian Army looks for in a candidate: Garima Paliwal's answer to What are 15 OLQs for an SSB interview? In order to know what should be done in SSB one should also know what shouldn’t be done in SSB : Garima Paliwal's answer to What should never be done in SSB? Thank you for reading..

First thing you must focus on first day because during screening you judge for very short period of time so better  * You practice your original story,, please do not copy from any SSB guidance book.  *listen to other also during group discussion.  *put your point with logical view.  *please practice for WAT, TAT, SRT before going to SSB. Many have clear without practicing but you would be at higher end.  *during personal interview, carefully listen questions asked because many time when they ask about you they  ask multiple questions and answers them in same sequence they are asked.  *if you don't know something say directly "sorry sir I don't know"  Please do not try to bullf.  *during command task if you are taken as helper, do not give conflicting advice to your commander.  *in group task be with group and speak out loud your ideas and try to do it also, remember in group task many get demoralized because they haven't done anything or given any idea but this is not the end perform better at command task things will be taken as granted.  *during command task choose no. Of subordinate carefully.   Note : personally SSB is really a great experience enjoy with your friends go for visiting city and market with friend.

This question is very very difficult to answer. The reason why i say so, is because I came across a person few months ago who was, like everyone else, preparing hard for SSB. He was with me in my board. Had prepared topics of general knowledge and current affairs astoundingly well. His command over the English language and communication skills were just perfect. He was well read and a gentleman in every sense of the word. To top it all, he was well buit and in amazing shape. He could easily give the best models a run for their money. We had no doubts that he will get recommended. That he easily did. On the basis of physical appearance also, he was more fit than I have ever looked in my life (and mind you, I did clear my medicals easily)!We already called him a US marine for his physical appearance. But in Special medical Board after the recommendation he was declared unfit and given a TR for high BP and a heart problem. We all thought it is a mistake and he will clear easily in the AMB.But Appeal Medical Board brought further shocks. His ECG revealed he had  a congenital problem in his heart. It would never interfare in then normal life functions. He could lead a very healthy life easily. But he was unfit for Army. Given a PR. World came crashing down. Not just for him but for us as well. The above is not a story but a true incident. I do not want to demotivate anyone. It is just a reality check. Do your best to prepare for SSB. But the strongest of individuals make sure that they are prepared for the worst as well. Preparing for SSB is not a herculean task. Heck, it is not difficult at all. You could pick up any SSB book from the market and that is all the guidance you would need. But inculcating the OLQs is some task. One must understand it well and learn it.

SSB is all about personality which includes both physical and mental fitness. Physical fitness can be kept as second priority because it is not tested to that level. Now, talking about the preparation, if you want to be an officer you got to behave like an officer. There are many things which can be done.  You can start with communication skills. An officer is a really good orator. His speaking skills are above par. An officer looks confident when he speaks. These things make communication skills very important. Try to convey your thoughts in english as much as you can. This will automatically help you in developing confidence. Most of us very comfortable in speaking hindi or our mother tongue, this is because people around us talk in this language. Same goes with english, until you start conversing in this language you won't improve. Writing answers on Quora will also help.  Next thing is awareness. An officer is very well aware of his surroundings. When I was going for my first SSB, I met a retired IAF officer. I asked him the same question as to how I can really gain knowledge about a particular topic. To which he replied that read newspaper daily. I will explain the further conversation with an example. Suppose the news was about ISIS. Now, you read that this terrorist organisation has done something. Next step is to know about this organisation, how it developed, how it can affect the whole world, what is its history. Basically, a detailed analysis. Many of us don't have so much time. So, you can simply read the headline, that will also help. There are few good apps on play store such as Jagran Josh.  Physical fitness can be improved by doing some basic exercises or if you are playing sport regularly then that will also help. You can try skipping rope, playing badminton or basketball. These sports are not too much time taking and will give you amazing results.  Read, read and read. Read about anything you find. Make great use of Quora. When I started preparing for SSB, I was introduced to Quora by my friend, and trust me it has helped me a lot. I had no idea about the Kashmir issue but today I can confidently narrate the whole history of Kashmir to anyone. Not just about this, but whatever field you like you can reqd about it.  One of the most important things is honesty. Be honest to yourself. Try to inculcate all these things in your daily routine. Be honest when you talk to your parents, be honest when you confess your mistakes. In the long run this will help you a lot.  There are 4 basic things required to crack SSB. Confidence, honesty, knowledge and will power. If you look at the tests conducted, you will observe that these 4 qualities are what they are looking for. Be confident and honest to accept if you don't know any answer. Be confident when you speak to anyone. Have enough knowledge to make your presence felt during any discussion anywhere, not just SSB. And last but not the least. Will power. Never ever give up. There will be times when you will lack motivation, you might even doubt your ability but that is when you have to be strong and believe that one day, I am gonna earn that uniform. Hope this helps. Best of luck.

SSB is all about three words and how are you justifying those words in yourself and those three magical words are MANSA←→VACHA←→KARMA=Thought←→Process←→Action. Whatever your life and and personality is, just project it into the frame of 15 OLQs(Officer Like Qualities) and display them there at SSB at each and every step whether its psych or interview or GTOs. The most important thing to note is - “If the four circles of what you ARE, what you THINK, what you DO/WRITE, and what you DO THERE… SUPERIMPOSE you will definitely be recommended by them.”(Somebody else’ words but really worked and helped me):-) INTERVIEW Specials points: 1) Do not FLAUNT, Please Please don’t do it. 2) What you say you must Justify it, like if I say I went on a trek so I have to answer the situation which will be poured upon me after that by the interviewee. 3) Don’t fumble because he’s not asking you about someone else he’s asking you about yourself (i.e. no one else know more about you except yourself ) so you should and must be confident about you and your manipulations. 4) Don’t let any of your single task’s performance pessimist your mind, like you didn’t perform well in PGT or in SRT or let anything don’t just boggle around it overcome it because SSB judges your all round performance so be confident even about you failures and be ready to accept them. 5) The last and the most important one is Be Crisp and sharp in your talks. Talk like an officer, walk like an officer, but be a good human, a humble one and you will make it. All the best!! JAI HIND!! JAI BHARAT!! Comments are welcomed…….

You can always get the test pattern and normal tips online. Pay attention to these points for success. I have cleared my SSB for 10+2 B.tech and NDA in my first and second attempt respectively. Never have eye contact with the examiner during the group discussion.It is not necessary to talk more during group discussion to get selected.Getting selected as a member of helper team during command task is not a great advantage.Wearing a light coloured shirt keeps your body cool and helps enhance thinking.Never use the word “very”. It means no scope for improvement. i.e. very hard etc.You won't get selected if you talk frankly and openly about yourself during the interview like Raju Rastogi in 3 Idiots. You only have to show the interviewing officer how much it is required to get selected .Talking slowly is better than stumbling during interview .Tell the truth if you don't know something during the interview. I couldn't answer any of the technical questions asked during my second SSB for NDA. I answered that “I am not aware I will find out “. I accepted during conference that I did not do interview to my capability.Never fight with team mates. They are an important factor for your selection. He friendly during and after testing . Don't forget to enjoy in the dorm .The most important of all.. concentrate on the test rather than judging people during the discussion. It'll help you perform better without pressure.These are some tips out of my own experience. There are many advices out there. Do give heed to these points. Hope you understood!!! Cheers! !

SSB is not an exam like others which can be qualify in one go but, it is five day long process in which which candidates are tested in every manner. Passion and dedication are two important factors that are necessary for any candidate to clear SSB. Time management and work hard are necessary. Firstly, candidate need to understand OLQs(Officers’ Like Qualities), how important it is be in a candidate.Secondly, Screening of a candidate is based on 2 phases, one is Officer Intelligence Ratting Test (OIRT) test and Picture Perception and Discussion Test (PPDT). So, for Screening in, candidate must need to prepare for OIRT and PPDT. For OIRT start practicing for basis Aptitude, Verbal and Non-Verbal reasoning (100 questions in a day) and for PPDT make habit of writing, start observing things and make a habit of writing on that, cause it will definitely help candidate for PPDT and TAT (Thematic Apperception Test, Commonly known as Picture Story writing) also.Third, Candidate must know about himself, his week and strong points, it will help in Self Description Test.Fourth, prepare Current affairs, it will be helpful in Personal interview and Lecturette . Start practicing for lecturette in front of your family and friends (daily 4 to 5 topics).Fifth, for Obstacles phase, do some physical exercise like wall climbing, rope climbing, running. It will not only help candidate during Obstacles task but also it keeps candidate fit and fine.Improve General awareness, Vocabulary.You don’t need to follow any specific book SSB, all you can do is follow some books for Vocabulary and GK.Read newspaper.Make writing habit.Write effectively and impressively.Prepare yourself under the allotted time duration.Be precise with your words.Think positive.Be relax and confident.And most important, be natural and be yourself.This is all from my side. Hope, it will help :) All the Best!

First of all you have to know what are all the tests conducted by SSB. For know about the SSB tests just search in google or buy a book. It is only useful for know about the instructions. It is not a study material. OLQ-Officer Like Qualities. Here I attached some olq. It is very important to get recommend. Try to live with OLQ. Officer Like Qualities. Effective Intelligence.Reasoning Ability.Power of Expression.Self Confidence.Determination.Organizing Ability.Initiative.Courage.Cooperation.Sense of Responsibility.Stamina.Group Influencing Ability.Liveliness.Social Adaptability.Speed of DecisionBe informed- learn about the procedure of ssb and talk to some recommended candidates. Practice- Now,practice for the tests one by one like Intelligence tests(verbal and non verbal),TAT,WAT,SRT,SD etc. Fitness and GTO- Work on your fitness.Run daily and learn to work as a group. Try to find answer to situations while having a calm mind. Interview-For the interview,be informed,learn about current affairs,be truthful,prepare your answers beforehand so that you can answer any counter questions if asked. Be confident and don’t give up if the officer puts you in pressure. That means he likes you and if you get this right,you will be selected as well.Finally, remember that it is more important to do well in all three tests in order to get selected. you have to go to SSB and want to prepare for it. First of all I would like to say that, SSB is the test of one’s personality. You can;t change your personality for this interview. Your real self will ultimately come out in SSB, however you can enhance yourself.Regarding training for SSB, it depends whether you have considerable time left or in a haste, whatever may be your case but there are some things that you can do to prepare for SSB 1.Please visit SSBcrack.com, it’s the best SSB preparation website(I use it too!) 2.Read newspaper daily and be abreast with current affairs( I prefer Hindu and The Indian Express) 3.Purchase a good SSB book and follow the procedure,practice tests like WAT,SRT,TAT etc (Arihant/SSBcrack) 4.Improve your communication skills, speak up in formal occasions, give lectures and if you don’t have that kind of atmosphere just prepare a talk for yourself. 5.Enhance your behavior, try to inculcate the Officer Like Qualities or the OLQ’s. 6. Be proactive and Self Introspect. (It’s easier said than done!) 7. Try to overcome your shortcomings and conquer them slowly. 8.Practice verbal and Non-Verbal Intelligence test.(Required for Stage I in SSB) 9. Improve your body language by any way you find effective and please have a lot of SELF-CONFIDENCE.(That’s the most important virtue) 10. In the end the most important point for SSB. Never ever Lie in SSB, so start to extract that from your life from now onward so that by the time you give SSB you don’t say anything but the Truth. Coaching can never ensure your SSB recommendation. Rather the recommendation resides in your own hands. Your personal behavior and mentality are what all they need and to show it, you need to analyze yourself and be what you are. Cramping and burdening yourself with unfavorable mediums can make you more obsess and will turn you down.

SSB is a prestigious selection board selecting candidates who will be fit enough to become officers or can be trained to become officers in the armed forces . Officers in the selection board look on to candidate's behavior and character and awareness which reflects in every situation of life (in short -the personality of each candidate) conducting different stages or rounds of tests . To be well prepared for SSB a candidate should Be aware of all the rounds or stages in the selection process .Introspect the good and bad , strength and weakness, hobbies, activities most interested in, favourite things in each part of our regular routine, self evaluation.Social awareness of what is happening in and around us as a daily activity.Basic physical fitness to perform the ground tasks by regular jogging and exercise .Practice to speak out valid points when given chance to do so.Practice the written tests with time restriction.Apart from these preparations, it's very important for each to stay motivated and confident upon the destination we had chosen.. As our legend's quote says “If you want to shine like a sun, first burn like a sun” So start living like an officer, to become one. Start developing the qualities in day to day activities of our life so that there won't be much difficulty in portraying it when need. When we repeat the same thing everytime, that becomes our character… and it shall be expressed without effort  All the best ! Jai hind

Assuming this to be your first attempt to SSB, I will suggest you few things: Update yourself with the events happening around the world. Have a clear self introspection. In ssb assessors look for 15 OLQs in you. So, note down those 15 OLQs and try to self introspect to know that which quality you have in you most and least and work on them accordingly. Get an opinion about yourself from Parents, friends, teachers. As this will help you to prepare for self description test of psychology and to know the level of OLQs as well. But your self introspection is more important.NEVER FAKE AT ANY POINT IN LIFE.  DON'T LOOSE REAL YOU. BE YOURSELF. Improve your personality as an army officer by your day to day activities.

Tips..? About cracking SSB? Well sorry I won't give you any...as many others will give you the golden rules of what you must do and what you must not but I promise you this...if you follow these advices by others you are not going to clear it for sure..SSB is about you... A dash of liveliness is what helps you keep in a good mood always in the ssbHave a sense of responsibility.. If you do a mistake owe it up..don't deny it.Be normal...don't try to show off..you will be comfortable and confident when you are just being you..Be determined about your ideas and goals that is have some confidence in self and be cooperative with othersTake initiative and express your ideas powerfully.. Services Selection Board (SSB) conducts interviews for candidates for admission into the Armed Forces of India. For interviews like these, you do not need any special preparation. It is about your Self Assessment, your Qualities that they look into. Be yourself and Confident. Qualities Needed: Intellect, Responsibility, Initiative, Judgement under stress, Ability to Reason and Organize, Communication Skills, Determination, Courage, Self-Confidence, Speed in decision making, Willingness to set an example, Compassion and a feeling of loyalty to the Nation. The interview involves Personality & Intelligence Tests and Interviews to assess the candidate's suitability for commission to the Armed Forces. The selection is based on five day process: after documents verification Day 1 - Screening testVerbal and Non-Verbal Intelligence Test (About 50 questions each)Picture Perception and Description Test (PPDT) (Memory game and make a story from the picture)Fill the personal information questionnairesDay 2 - Psychological TestsThematic Apperception Test (TAT) (They will show a picture and you should write a story)Word Association Test (write the first thought that come to your mind)Situation Reaction TestSelf Description TestDays 3 and 4 - Group tasksGroup DiscussionGroup TasksIndividual TasksPersonal InterviewDay 5 - Compilation of results In ConferenceFinal Assessment - ConversationResultsSuccessful candidates remain medical examinationJai Hind

Okay first let me tell you about what SSB is. It is set up by the Ministry of Defense. They undertake the SSB Interview to evaluate prospective candidates for recruitment in the Army, Navy and Air Force. Candidates are assessed based on intelligence, personality, compatibility and potential. Unmarried graduates who clear the Combined Defense Services Examination conducted by the UPSC are selected for the SSB Interview. The five-day personality and intelligence test schedule is as under: Day 1: Basic Intelligence TestDay 2: Psychological TestDay 3 & Day 4: The Group Testing Officers ActivitiesDay 5: ConferenceA Personal Interview (PI) can be taken on any day between Day2 & Day4 days. Many people might suggest you to go for self study. But I won’t. You will be needing training to improve your awareness, social graces, confidence and dynamism, to carry all information given by the training academy as useful tips at the back of your mind for application using own intelligence during the SSB. A training academy will be conducting interactive sessions to promote self confidence and public speaking skills,. They will give feedback to improve basic social graces, explain fundamentals of various tests and tasks, and give feedback for correcting the undesirable biases of thinking. Well , I have heard about Siegwald Academy which is situated in Kolkata. One of the trusted defense career training academy in India. They have their own outdoor facility. They have the largest team of officers who are Ex SSB Presidents, GTO’s, and Psychologists from Army, Air Force, and Navy. The best part is that apart from the SSB preparation, you can also learn from the experience of successful students and contact them personally!

Try to learn current affair and news ,generally they donot ask about that ,but might be chance they will be .if your engg. You should know about your domain. 8. psychology test give your best answer ,no need to write always positive things ,as per picture and word ,you must think as per condition at same time ,for that try to practice it. Thanks for the A2A. To crack the SSB interview the most important thing you need is a book on SSB. A book which describes every test in detail. You will find such books in Amazon. Then you need practice especially in psychological evaluation. You need to be able to write all the questions in the given time. Next you need to know the real reason for so many tests. The basis of the SSB interview is that the kind of person that you show yourself to be in the psych test must be the same kind of person who you show during GTO. When you show in psychological evaluation that you are an extrovert but in GTO you turn out to be an introvert then you are clearly trying to cheat the assessors. This virtue is not sought after. That's why people say that you should be yourself in SSB. There is no set personality type required in the army. They don't want people who are already brave and strong. Then such guys don't need to be trained and they will instead question the training. It doesn't matter if you are a scared person. The training will turn you into a lion. The army just wants honest people who will work hard. If you can show such virtues you will be able to crack every SSB you go to.

Let's start from screening test. First you would be required to take an OIR test. For this, you should prepare verbal and non verbal reasoning very well Then you would need to write , narrate and discuss a story based on a picture shown to you. For this, improve your imagination, writing and communication skills. For psychology and interview, you need to know about yourself very very well. You would need a lot of introspection, invest time in knowing about yourself , what you are, what you want to be, how you face situations, how you feel about people around you etc. Also, read newspaper daily and know thoroughly about what's happening in the world. For group tasks, it is all about practical ideas, spontaneity , team work which you cannot build in a month or so , it requires time and is generally hard wired inside you. So, polish your personality and all the best for SSB.

Firstly,know what the ssb is al about by watching the ssb-Bhopal video through youtube and visit SSB Interview Tips & Coaching | SSBCrack to know the complete details. Now from my side firstly i would suggest you to introspect yourself so that you can find your strengths and weakness well.Now in short i am telling you the ways to prepare for ssb- Do practice of officers intelligence rating test(OIR) that was conducted on the 1st day of ssb.You can buy arihant books for practicing.Start practicing for PPDT (picture perception and description test) by writing short stories by seeing the picture for 30 sec and then write your story in 4 minutes.After writing story narrate it infront of the mirror which will help you in narrating your story fluently.Start reading english newspaper it will help you in keeping you aware about what is going on around the world and also in India ,it will help you during GD and lecturette.Have a look on OLQs i.e officer like qualities and try to bring these qualities in yourself.Before going to SSB take a look at PIQ form whatever you write in it,the interviewer take interview according to your PIQ.

There are a number of ways to prepare yourself for the SSB interview. To start off with, self - introspect and prepare a presentable description of yourself. From your schooling, to friends and family, to your achievements etc.. have a thorough understanding of each of them. Know yourself in terms of your strengths and weaknesses. Try to gather information regarding your stream of education, the sports and hobbies you indulge and your interests. This will help you to be confident while speaking. Next, spend time reading the newspaper or magazines such as India Today or Outlook on a regular basis as this will help in not only strengthening your language but also your general knowledge. Watch documentaries by National Geographic or Discovery; this will improve your understanding of presentation. Watching debates will also help in building speaking and reasoning ability. All this together will help in getting yourself prepared for the SSB interview. Most importantly, above all of this, remember to be honest to your true self and confident. DO NOT falsify anything about yourself or anything that you may not know about. Stay calm and honest and present yourself with confidence.
