response.answer_text: Well i dont think the past selectors or even the senior Ex-GTO’S know what exactly the SSB wants or needs from a candidate. I’ve seen my friends take coaching from reputed coaching centers and learn about everything from the tasks , obstacles ,interviews and WAT & TAT and so on. But once you go through the process of SSB you realize that the Army doesn't need people who are already well trained but people who can be trained and molded. Ive seen physically strong candidates towering over 6ft getting rejected and super lanky dudes gettin through. Not that you shouldnt go for coaching or prep but the most important thing to note is and work on are the OLQ or Officer Like Qualities. YOU CANNOT TRAIN FOR THESE QUALITIES IN A DAY . Or even a month , you must bring them into your daily life. Your Psychological tests are very very important. Pay heed to them and you wont have any trouble during the SSB interviews. But also maintain the idea in your mind that Board of Selectors dont really tell you why or give a reason for your non selection. So self assesment is crucial. More than anything just show your keeness and ability to them , they're humans after all (though cold af) but they know a deserving candidate when they see one

Service Selection Board Interviews are something every armed forces aspirant has to clear to fulfill his dream. There is this one question that you have to answer yourself honestly and you had to be really honest."Do you have it in you ?"It is this one question that pops up every where in your interview.They are several books on HOW to clear the SSB. Before that ask yourself ask WHY ? Once you make up your mind on that the rest is pretty straight forward. 1. Know yourself and prepare yourself accordingly.2.Get some books and know the basics.3.Don't worry about physical fitness, just get in good shape.5.Go there and give your best.Don't worry about the result and be a team man.

Some Common Mistakes To Avoid During SSB Interview Apostrophe: the utilization of apostrophe may be a minefield for many . Words like “its” and “it’s” are most vulnerable to mistakes. Similarly, when a word ends in “s”, will you set an “’s” or not? These are mistakes which require careful correction by an expert. During your training at the simplest SSB institute in Kolkata, Siegwald Academy, stress is placed on such small details in order that your knowledge and usage is ideal . Contractions: In using English, we frequently use contractions like “they’re” and “you’re”. But how different are they from “their” and “your”? You have to understand the proper usage in order that you write them correctly also as pronounce them the right way. In this case, the former are both contractions of “they are” and “you are” while the latter are possessive cases. Word Meanings: There are some words, like “affect” and “effect”, which are close in meaning and pronunciation but not quite the same. The distinction makes all the difference. While “affect” may be a verb, “effect” may be a noun. There is subtle difference in meaning also , not just use. You have to be particular about these details, just like the difference between the words “look”, “see” and “watch”. Prepositions: the sole section of grammar where you would like to memorize instead of understand, some prepositions are often quite tricky! Observe the difference between “into” and “in to”, or between the prepositions “since” and “for”. Professional English teachers at SSB training institutes like Siegwald Academy will guide you to use the language properly and properly . By learning correct English for SSB, you've got better chances of cracking the written and interviews.

Your interview will go good , if you have well introspected yourself, if you have developed good communication and presentation skills. The interviewer over there, is interested in your speech i.e how you think and express your views. I know many, who even have the best ideology about a subject, but aren't good at expression, and also many who don't know much, but present whatever they know, pleasently. Here are few things you can inhibit in your daily life. Inspire yourself to aspire.You must never lack confidance, one must see a living lion inside you.don't underestimate yourself. The i/o will try to surpress you, regarding your views. Be fearless,and bold.Start talking to everyone in your vicinity.Never lack confidance in initiatings the talk. Be it your school principal,or your near home uncle, start communicating with her in any sensible topic. Also, in my opinion, a person will never stammer, if he knows the subject. Read, know about things going on over the world. If you are curious about things, u ought to know it. Gain knowledge, spread knowledge. Since, the mode of language in ssb is english only, u must start speaking english. Talk your mother in english, your friends in english. I know it's embarrising, if you aren't used to. But you have to implement. Hoping for your best. Jay hind 🇮🇳

There is always a thing which favours a fresher, it is called beginner’s luck. But don’t rely on it completely. It is an adage. Well, How to prepare for the interview procedure, i’ll write down a few suggestions: Get to know all the events of SSB very well with right approach. Events like Screening, WAT, TAT, SRT, SD, GTO tasks, Interview(personality test), conference.Start mirror speaking so as to increase your fluency in expressing your ideas. It will help you in all the discussion events.Practice story writing, it will help you in screening and TAT.Develop a habit of reading newspapers to stay updated with national & international events.Go for exercises to increase stamina to tackle with outdoor Ground Tasks.Start interacting with your friends and discuss with them some topics to get ease in talking in a group.Get to know more & more about the forces. In your case focus more on Navy.Now, for all this you can do it all by yourself or you can take some professional guidance. But maintain your originality. Some the last advices would be: Draw a strict and efficient schedule for your weekdays and weekends and follow it by your heart.Worship whatever you prepare and do.Remember, hard work leads to success.

There is no master tip to clear SSB, however remember at the end of the day it's a job interview combined with a battery of psychological tests to evaluate your personality ( To suit leadership requirements of a combat leader) . You should know how tests are conducted ( If you are a repeater) obviously you know) Carry out introspection of your earlier experiences and practice to improve your earlier shortcomings. Keep fit, read newspapers and be generally aware of what's happening around you, follow important events, national and international and with like minded friends discuss. As for psychological tests practice writing with a view to complete and give out maximum responses. You can do that only if you write your first impressions, if you make up your responses it takes time resulting in lower responses from your side. Be friendly with all in the group, be helpful, ( You will gain from sharing and discussing). Do have adequate knowledge of the service you intend to join Army, Navy or Airforce . In today's age information is on your fingertips so you would come across very poorly if you don't have basic knowledge during your group discussions or your interviews. All the best

FIRST understand what the process is.. then as we know that it has three parts which includes physcologyGtoInterview.so, the first thing you have to focus is getting screened in for these processes. FOR SCREENING IN : concentrate on your communication skills by reading,speaking or watching Hollywood films or series.Then practice PPDT and OIR regularly.As we know nothing can be done at a single go ..so practice regularly. Then now go on once you have mastered these.. 1.FOCUS ON PHYSCOLOGY PART: For this I can suggest you to buy a book called CRACKING THE CODE OF PHYSCOLOGY available on amazon(suggested by a recommended candidate). PRACTICE SRT WAT TAT on regular basis. 2.THEN COMING TO GTO.. Watch Gto videos from YouTube. And I prefer you to buy a book written by CDR NK NATRAJAN 3. INTERVIEW The most important part of SSB which holds maximum point. Simple points to clear this can be Be yourselfA good leader is one who never exaggerates his achievements and one who doesn't feel bad for his losses.Be confident (a solid preparation gives you more confident)Have a smile.BE NUDE BEFORE THREE ACCESSORS THEY WILL DRESS YOU WITH THE UNIFORM. HOPE IT HELPS YOU. THANK YOU.

Hello, Steps for Preparing for SSBs depends from person to person. I have attempted 4 SSBs till day and reached till conference twice. How you need to prepare depends on you and to decide that one needs to understand the testing & evaluation process very clearly. Preparing day wise is best methodology in my understanding. Day 1: It deals with Screening process in two parts: Part 1 : OIR(Officer Intelligence Test) Test 1: Verbal It consists of 45 question to be done in 22 minutes. Questions consists of basic Mathematics and English. You need to be excellent in Elementary level of both the subjects to solve it efficiently and there is no negative marking. Test 2: Non Verbal This also consists of same number of questions to solved in 19 minutes. Questions consists of patterns and series. You need to very quick and analytical in solving the puzzles. Its fun and similar to solving puzzles but time runs very fast and you might feel like playing under pressure. Break of 15–30 minutes is given depending on Center and batch size. Part 2 : PP&DT (Picture Perception and Descripition Test) In this a Picture is shown to you for 30 seconds and time period of 4 minutes is given to write down the story as per your imagination. One is free to write anything. For this imagination should be wide open and writing speed must be around 30 words per minute. Then comes the description part in which 1 minute is given to every candidate to narrate his/her own story and after that 20 minutes is collectively given to discuss the same and conclude the picture. Tips for same ; Don’t try to put up only your story.Focus on getting the conclusion.Don’ be too low or too highControl hand gesture and tone of voiceAvoid creating Fish MarketDon’t directly cut the others point.Don’ Manipulate the story written and story narrated, be true to your imaginationTry to speak at-least 3–4 times in discussion.Now Its done for day one. Hope for the best. Day 2: Psychology Day You will definitely feel like its your board exam. You will writing for almost 4 hours without considerable break. This is again divided into 4 parts. All are designed in such a way to manipulate your brain. Be conscious and open to your thinking. You need to be very fast in writing down your thoughts and mind should be very quick in striking the thoughts. Don’t look here and there because that might demotivate you. Part 1 : TAT This exactly the same what you did in picture perception with similar timing structure but this time pictures are more clear and you will writing 12 stories back to back. 11 pictures are shown to you and 1 blank to imagine the picture and story on your own. Definitely all the story will have same theme based on your mind and brain. Don’t try to manipulate your thoughts. Keep practice of writing stories and imagination. I have seen people writing predefined stories irrespective of picture displayed. Trust me this never helps as assessors easily figures that out. Part :2 WAT This is similar to above and also completely different, in-place of picture displayed for 30 seconds a word is displayed for 5 seconds and 10 seconds are given to write a thought that strikes your brain, preferably in a form of sentence. NOTE : This is not a Sentence making Test, Be true to your thoughts. For reference it is like a game in movie “ Zindagi Na Milegi Dudara” Part 3: SRT This is similar to the part of game “Truth, Dare, Stare and Situation” In this test a booklet is given to you with 60 situations and time of 30 minutes. You need ti be very quick decision maker here as well as very fast writer. Nothing to worry as situations are easy but you might find that tough in that situation. Don’t fake your answers to show yourself what you are not as they will surely figure that oit in upcoming days. Part 4: SD The Most easy one Self Description. Throwing back to you primary school days, you are suppose to write an essay on My Self. But there is slight change in level. You have cover 5 prospective in this, you will describing your self from point of view of your : ParentsTeacher/ EmployerFriends / ColleagueYour SelfWhat you want to be?And for this you have 15 minutes. You can predefine and prepare for this part. Well again This day is done. Coming to Day 3 & 4 : I will like to go quickly through this, It consists of GT and PI GT : Group Task, As the test are over, task starts, you will be divided in groups of 8 to 10. Tasks are as follows and all needs team spirit and coordination GPE Group Planning Exercise : Whole group collectively have to solve a puzzle.GD Group Discussion : Advises are same as above but now group size is smaller try to speak as much points you can, Don’t facts and numbers without any strong references. Have a healthy discussion. There will be two GDs. For 1 Topic has to be mutually chosen and in another topic is given to you. Prepare well with general knowledge, current affairs and public Speaking.PGT. HGT, CT, Snake Race, IO, FGT are some of Ground Tasks. Be physically fit and have good stamina. This all few simple set of rules which will be explained by GTO, listen to them carefully.Lectureate : This is simple as the word, you have to pick a card, choose a topic out of four, prepare for 3 minutes given to you and speak for three minutes in front of your group mates. Topics will be from Science, GK and Current Affairs. You are judged on basis of your topic chosen as that clearly describes your interest, style of delivery which describes your leadership quality and content which describes your knowledge.Then comes the one of most important i.e. PI Personal Interview. Generally it is conducted by IO(Interviewing Officer), Vice- President or President of that Board. Be well dressed, if in formals ( I am saying this because Sometimes you have to appear it in your GT Dress). Be little Self Conscious and walk straight with energy. Questions are very simple as well as very tricky. Don’t even think of bluffing or else interviewer can put you to vertigo. You will be asked about yourself, your family, financial status, schooling, higher education, problems faced by you and how you handled the same, few personal questions, questions from your educational background, you routine on holidays and normal days, your interests and hobbies, your likes and dislikes, your attachments, your friends and in nut-shell all about yourself along with your knowledge in current affairs and general knowledge. You will be asked questions in comprehensive manner, don’t miss any single detail asked, try to remember all what you are asked. He might show no interest in listening you just to distract you but don’t fall in trap. Answer all questions genuinely. Prepare for the Question like “ What and How you prepared for SSB?” Answer to this will show the things you rely on for important things in like! Keep smile Up and Fill Free to drink Water if Required. You might be asked about the stay facility, food and city, avoid criticizing though liked it or not. Remember the names of your roommates because that is all interviewers ask most of the time. That’s All ! Now Relax and Wait for Conference. You have given your best and in conference all the assessors will discuss and conclude about your recommendation. You will be called and asked about your stay and food and might be about one or two questions that you might have not been able to answer during interview. And you will be wished ALL THE BEST FOR FUTURE. From above you can analyse what all you need to work-on on yourself and prepare for SSB. Don’t fake it or blunder. Be genuine and real to yourself. It is well said be psychologist in one of my experience “INTROSPECTION IS THE BEST PREPARATION FOR SSB. If you find this helpful and need any further help feel free to contact me. ALL THE VERY BEST FOR PREPARATIONS AND UPCOMING SSB.

SSB is not an exam for which you need to prepare yourself. It's just the phase which checks inner you. Who is really inside you. Is there any similarity between inner and outer you? Things like this are checked through series of stage testing. For this you need to introspect yourself. You should be aware of your qualities. These qualities need time to get developed. It takes year to get moulded with these qualities. It's better to start today. Everyone has a mask which they wear infront of a society and the SSB staff is trained to tear out that mask. You should work on your qualities. If you already possess some of those qualities than don't work on others quality just refine those. You should prepare for verbal and non verbal series as they are the major reason for screening out than GD. 1 day of SSB requires these. On the other days you only need your qualities and moderate knowledge in General Awareness. Well i haven't faced any SSB but trust me the above mentioned information is the sum-up of various experiences. Good luck

Well I guess training is not the correct word. I feel mould is the right one. You need to mould your personality.See everyone has those 15 OLQ’s, all you need is to bring them outside. You should begin with having a proper daily routine, you should have the capability to set your priorities, you should read good literature, you must indulge yourself into some sports or cultural activities. Keep yourself busy. Coming to psychology part, you should really feel WAT ,SRT questions from the heart. Not some random sentence or reaction, you should write the reaction which is realistic and for WAT, a sentence that defines the inner you. Read current issues and be confident for public speaking because half of your GTO is based on this and it will help you for Interview. Thats all I can suggest !

Thanks for asking the question mam… For keeping your GK up to date Read newspaper, preferably THE HINDU. It really helps a lot.. But according to me more than GK, GA( General awareness ) is more important.. So start asking yourself about your ownself, your likes and dislikes, do you really know about those things completely.. for eg: The Shawshank redemption is one of my favorite movie but I didn't knew the meaning of redemption. Isn't it funny I didn't knew the meaning of my favorite movie. So try to ask as many questions as possible. It will help you increase your GENERAL AWARENESS a lot, and it will help in SSB for sure.. This is basically what I did before my SSB apart from writing psychological tests… ALL THE BEST for SSB…

Newspaper is a great source of preparation, it will improve your vocabulary communication skills and others. Secondly, u can prepare for TAT, WAT by observing the images and words respectively in the newspaper, e.g if u find an image of road accident or child labour u can construct a positive story out of it, Thirdly ur awareness level will improve which will help u in yr interview. Other than newspaper you should develop the habit of knowing about the services u hv opted for, I used to read about Air force so much thar even in my dreams I used to find myself airborne most of the time trying my hand on different jets.Anyways if u r passionate enough god will help u find ur way but mind you unless u put in ur efforts even almighty won't co operate.

“You cannot change yourself but you can always improve.” With that being said, here are few things you can do on a daily basis to improve - 1. General Awareness : Read - ‘The Hindu’ and BBC (Int’l News) 2. Practice for OIR, GD and psychological test (TAT, WAT, SRT) 3. Physically remain fit, whatever you wish to do. Walk - 2KM. 4. Discuss with friends (psychological test) 5. While you do all this, continue to do well in your main field - studies, work or whatever you must be doing. 6. Know yourself, in and out, Literally - covers your interview. 7. If repeater, then introspect. Correct your mistakes.

JOINING THE ARMED FORCES HAD ALWAYS BEEN A FASCINATING JOB AND ITS A MATTER OF GREAT RESPONSIBILITY AND HONOR FOR EVERYONE WHO WANTS TO SERVE THE NATION .NOW TO JOIN ANY OF THE ARMED FORCES ONE HAS TO FACE THE SSB INTERVIEW AND GET THROUGH IT . AFTER CLEARING THE WRITTEN WHEN YOU REALIZE THAT YOU HAVE TO APPEAR FOR THE TOUGHEST INTERVIEW IN INDIA ONE SHOULD BE PREPARED MENTALLY AND PHYSICALLY TO GET THROUGH EACH TEST. FIRSTLY YOU SHOULD REMEMBER THE 15 OLQ’S (OFFICERS LIKE QUALITIES) THAT SET’S THE STANDARD FOR A CANDIDATES TO BE TESTED . THESE OFFICERS LIKE QUALITIES ARE GENERALLY CATEGORISED IN 4 FACTORS 1: RELATED TO YOUR MIND 2:RELATED TO YOUR HEART 3:RELATED TO YOUR LIMBS 4: DYNAMICS i.e COURAGE , STAMINA AND DETERMINATION If tomorrow you have a algebra test you will study algebra similarly Ssb is all about the QLQ’S . Try to implement these qualities in your everyday life. Then only you could project your true self in front of the assessors. Also speaking in English and that too confidently is necessary . So improve your spoken English. Try to read English newspapers aloud,watch English debates on news channels like Lok sabha, and most importantly think in English in this way you would be confident when you are actually there in the Ssb . Lastly know yourself better. Find your strength and weakness . Work on your strength and improve your weakness and always speak the truth. There is no room for Lies in the armed forces. Don't change yourself but improve Yourself. Let us make the future now with hardwork and let us make our dreams tomorrow's reality Good luck.

You can start by stop asking such silly questions when there are hundreds, if not thousand questions and answers already on this site, and there are tens of cool websites which provide guidance for SSBs like ssbcrack.com . Note that these websites can only make you aware about the SSB process, and the only person that can help you to get recommended is you. So stop searching for the answers in the outside world and take a look inside. SSBs are looking for Officer like qualities (OLQs) in a candidate. An officer does not depends upon others for answers, he goes ahead and finds them. So a good idea for you might be to take a look at the OLQs and cultivate them inside yourself. If you have some of the OLQs, then the others can be developed, given some time and effort.

Hey! I'll bullet the the things I did. Was carefree. Didn't worry about the results right from day 1.Was happy and enjoying my stay.Smiling, the biggest smile I could have, and most probably because I thought I'll not make it.Confidently proceeding and attempting each testing procedure.Followed every instruction very carefully.Wasn't nervous at all. Not a bit.Little updated on current affairs.Dressed nicely.Didn't care how I sounded during GD, Lecturette, focussed on being logical.Was spontaneous and prompt.Energetic through the entire stay.Go freely, don't stress. Be confident and smile. :) Good luck!

Six days can prove to be a great turning point for you, your career and your dreams. However to succeed in these six days, you need to prepare in a systematic and regular manner. The question is how many days before your SSB you should start your preparation, and how many days are enough. The answer is that it depends on you, your efforts and your abilities. Nonetheless, extra preparations have never caused a hard. It is a common go-to line between students that if we’ll study from long before, we’ll forget it by the time the exams come. SSB is an exam for personality, and you need to work on your personality before anything. Let us see how you can prepare for SSB in thirty days: Initial 3 Days Know what all it takes: If you know your enemy well, you have won the war already. This is true for exams too, only that there is no enemy and no killing. If you know what all is going to come in SSB, what all is there is the tests, then you can obviously prepare well for it. So devote these days to know the SSB. Read all what you can to understand what all is there in each test. What is the pattern, what is the syllabus? Start your fitness regime: Start mild jogging and stamina building exercises. Getting into shape takes time. You’ll need a lot of stamina and strength for the long duration of tests in SSB. Also the Ground Tasks require a decent fitness level. Next 7 Days: Start with GA: You have start working on your General Awareness. Start reading the newspaper, make notes regarding important points. Collect information on probable topics of GD and lecturette. Read as much as you can. Self-Awareness: Write down everything you need to know about yourself and your near ones. This includes your positives, negatives, achievements. Basically an introspection of your personality. Your hobbies, interests and information related to that. Information related to your friends, family and their likes dislikes, and your likes and dislikes in them. Time yourself: Start with the PPT’s available for TAT, WAT and SRT. They come with an automatic timer. You can time yourself to perform in certain duration as required in the SSB. Every Psychological test in SSB is time bound, and that is their way of creating pressure on you. You need to practice to think fast at the spur of the moment. Write your SDT as well. Public Speaking: Start practicing lecturette, this will not only help in lecturette but in every task that requires public speaking.  The following Days: Read about the Forces: Gather basic and important information related to the Armed Force you have applied for. This will include information like commands, Chief of staff, recent procurements and ranks etc. Continue with what all you have been doing, such as practicing for psychological tests, lecturette, interview etc. See what all documents you’ll need for SSB. Make sure you have them. You can anytime refer to various articles available on our website regarding any help with any test. For any queries post your questions in the comment box below. Keep calm and give your best! Jai hind

Actually there is no separate preparation required to appear before SSB, where they assess your personality qualities to be a potential Officer in the Armed forces . You should be fairly Intelligent, be resourceful, able to Organise routine issues and express clearly. You should be rule abiding,responsible and considerate towards others. In addition , you should have faith in your abilities, decide early and motivate others around you to your line of thinking.You should be enduring, capable of taking calculated risks to achieve your objective. You should be generally aware of what is happening in the world and in your country, with good knowledge of Geography and History. Mind you, a Defence Officer is required to lead his/her men at War and there are no runners up in War.

First of all, I would like to tell my experience. I applied for Indian Navy and got call letter for SSB at NSB Coimbatore. Previously I did not have a single clue about the selection process( I just knew it was 5 day interview..thats all:-)) I just started a week before and was able to crack the Screening. Here are some tips: Always remember: SSB is not a competitive test. They want a good soldier: they care very little about your technical knowledge. So be cool.I think this video tutorial is very vital and covers almost everything in SSB:SSB PREPARATION: SSB PREPARATION - YouTubeMake sure that you at least say some 2–3 points in group discussion. And be patient while others say their stories.Wherever you go inside the premises maintain discipline. Each and every thing about you will be noted( and it is very easy for them to identitfy you as you will be always wearing your chest numbers)There are many tutorials availabe in YouTube. I think thats sufficient.All the best!

I would love to take my time and answer this.I read this experience and I found it amazing. The candidate was made to sit on a chair and the chair person (CP) sir ordered a coffee. Peon came with a coffee but he kept the glass of coffee in front of the candidate.CP sir asked the candidate "what is before you?"The candidate thought for 10-15 seconds and said "T"Yes. That was the answer. For, the question was "what is before *U* ?" Presence of mind matters in such interviews. :)

First fall we need to understand what is SSB all about. SSB is basically a personality and intelligence test in the war like situation. You have to go through very simple test during five days but what makes it difficult is time. In micro seconds you need to take your decision in the army and that’s what SSB is. Many people will give you many advice regarding clearing the SSB. But i would like to tell you that every situation you are going to face in SSB just face it like an Officer who has the responsibility of Many lives and his country. That is all.

SSB is all about 15 officers like qualities.  Its a five day long procedure to check whether you possess them or not. The best way for any defence aspirant is to understand these qualities and then introspect whether these qualities are possesed by them or not. Make your SORT analysis S- strengths, O- opportunities, R- responsibility, T- threats, Classify yourself into these and then make a proper plan because if you are failing to plan you are planning to fail. Now next step is to understand the entire 5 day process thoroughly, then think about yourself as an assessor. Point out different test and tasks in the entire process and mention the olq which is tested there, for example initiative is tested mostly in GTO where if you are the first person to speak in group discussions or first person to lead in PGT or HGT with valid suggestion s and solutions you will automatically get green signal in this olq. It will get easier for repeaters to make such observations and perform accordingly next time. Freshers require proper guidance or coaching ( not necessary ) . Finally it's a test of your trainablity, if they find you good enough in all these 4 Factors (15 olqs ) you are through it. All the best 👍💯 jai hind You can follow me on Instagram for any more suggestions or queries @natural_nimish .

Thanks for a2a If you are a fresher, don’t take any coaching. Buy a Arihant’s SSB book, understand the whole procedure.Talk to your friends who have been to SSB, their experience will help.I would strongly suggest you to watch AFOSOP video tutorial series on youtube. It actually proved to be very helpful for me. And if you are a repeater, even then, try to improve things yourself. And if you still feel that you need professional help,chose a coaching WISELY. At the end, I would say SSB is a personality based test, that means if you have it in you, you will be picked up by them.Just be yourself, enjoy your stay there. Hope it helps. Jai Hind.

Well this is something which might implicitly help: Read atleast one newspaper. Try to create opinion about various important issues related to our country and world.Please involve yourself into some kind of physical exercise, which will help you keep fit.Also, please revisit the subjects you have studied in your school or college. Since many questions are related to the subjects you have chosen to study.Following which participate in this extra curricular activities to improve in management skill holistically. Along with that work on your communication skill.If you still don't feel confident, you can take guidance from AFOSOP or No Frills Academy - They are helpful.

I am writing this answer as for SSB. Not particularly for the interview. This is a good action plan- Be informed- learn about the procedure of ssb and talk to some recommended candidates.Practice- Now,practice for the tests one by one like Intelligence tests(verbal and non verbal),TAT,WAT,SRT,SD etc.Fitness and GTO- Work on your fitness.Run daily and learn to work as a group. Try to find answer to situations while having a calm mind.Interview-For the interview,be informed,learn about current affairs,be truthful,prepare your answers beforehand so that you can answer any counter questions if asked. Be confident and don’t give up if the officer puts you in pressure. That means he likes you and if you get this right,you will be selected as well.Finally, remember that it is more important to do well in all three tests in order to get selected. Jai hind!

First of all. Take a complete knowledge about the procedure of SSB. Points to remember while preparing for SSB. be true to yourself.Do not lie. If you are having negative thing try to answer it some other way so that it will look better than negative.Self introspection( every thing about you,your family, positive things, negative things, behaviour of all, academic, co-caricular activities, friends, teacher and lot)Keep your body regular to any exercise and sports.Ssb dont want to know how much you know. They check whether you can defend youself on what you say to them. You can practise WAT(word association test) few times. Be up to date with international and national news. Try to be yourself. Don’t lie.

There are 3 stages of SSB and all linked together. 1. Mansa - psychology 2. Vacha - Person Interview 3. Karma - Ground task First thing first - know yourself. If you are 23 yrs old and can't speak 20 mins about yourself then you have to analyze where you went wrong. Practice this. Then, practice more of PP&DT. Keep urself calm in Group discussions. Speak less but speak effective. Basic rule for any GD. Practice more of SRT, WAT, TAT. Pen down SDT and remember it for the rest of your life. Make sure you add OLQs in the same indirectly. For e.g., rather writing that you are a good decision maker, write - your parents ask or take advise before taking any major family decisions. Read good article on technologies, policies, etc. Stay updated on day to day happenings. Do remember to polish your hobbies. If you are trekking freak then how you will prove the same...either you should have vast knowledge about trekking or certifications or both. All the best!

Dear friend, i would suggest you to improve your gk, at least be aware with what is happening around the world and how it is affecting the environment around. secondly, work upon the 15 OLQ’S improve your attitude towards life, be positive in every situation no matter what. the best method to mend your attitude is to start thinking like a fauji . take every action after keeping in mind how a real fauji would react in this particular situation. thirdly, prepare for every task in the ssb individually, that means. work upon wat , tat, srt .improve your physical strengthprepare for the interview.get your responses of tat , wat , srt checked by an experienced . all the best, do well

On daily basis phycology tests must be practiced every day either it is tat,wat or srt. Other than this give time to know youself and your surroundings deeply. Your present ,past and future. Reading current affair books like csr should also be done to be well updated . One hour should be given for interview questions and the format in which they are asked. LECTURE PRACTICE IS A MUST TO DO THING DAILY. Either infront of mirror or just speaking to parents or friend. Make habit of speaking in english in every conversation. Physical exercise must also be done daily just to be fit. Even running or skipping for a while will help. Schedule must be of same format as the full interview goes . This way you can manage time and know how the interview will go in five day.

SSB interview is one of it's kind, it is totally different from what you can expect or even think of, there is no prior knowledge required, just your basic problem solving skills are required, there won't be any academic questions. To train your self for same, try to be good listener and observer, everything what you will be interviewed on will be explained by them their itself, and coming to part of physical test, would request you to read the requirements of any old NDA exam announcement in Employment New Paper.

First you report to the SSB centre then they give opening address .. First form filling is done .. after that actual ssb process starts detailed as follow  Day 1 Phase I testing – Officers Intelligence Rating Test & Picture Perception and Discussion test People who could not make it will be sent back on the same day. Others will be retained for four more days. Day 2 Psych test - WAT , TAT, SRT, Self Description  In addition to these for flying branch either in IAF or Navy pilot entry - PABT will be conducted. Day 3 Group tests / Interview Day 4 Group tests / Interview Group test / Ground tasks consists of GD, PGT, HGT, FGT, CT, GPE, Individual obstacle, group obstacle race, lecturette. Day 5 Conference  People who recommend  it will be  retained for four more days of medical  Others will be sent back on the same day.. ALL THE BEST..

SSB interview is entirely different from regular interviews. There they don't check how much intelligent you are,they check wether you know what to do with knowledge or not. Coming to main interview part, I'll tell you something about my interview experience. Interviewer didn't asked me anything outside my life i.e. my family,friends,relatives,hobbies and studies. (# he asked Newton law's also :p # ) These all things are also asked in PIQ so they just need to check wether you are telling them truth or not. So just be confident in yourself and remember not to lie in PIQ or in interview. All the best.

NDA is one of the ways to get into the Army, Navy and Air Force. SSB plays very important role in selection process ,so obviously this is the most important question. If you start preparing both written exam and for SSB interview, then it will be good for you. This is how you can train yourself for SSB interview: Start your preparations by running daily.Enhance your thinking by being more realistic.Start spending more time with your friends/colleagues. This will improve your social skills and make you more confident.Start reading newspapers and current affairs.Introspect yourself. Know your strengths and weaknesses.Know the SSB procedure inside out.Revise your academic knowledge.Take coaching if you are lazy, feel under-confident, couldn’t prepare on your own , visit SAFALTA CLASS on YouTube (Just for a suggestion)Be Confident! If you find it helpful do Up vote.

In one sentence → Start living. Almost 95% of people in this world are unaware of themselves and their surroundings. SSB is nothing more that knowing yourself and others. It is all about being you(helps in Interview with I.O.) , a human being(helps in all stages) , not a leader then at least a follower(PGT) , a critical thinker(again PGT/TAT/SRT/WAT) , an observer(PGT/I.O./CT) , a socialist(GD/Lecturrete) , calculated risk taker(Individual Obstacle/PGT) , a debater(GD) , an orator(Lecturrete) . If you are able to inculcate these human behavior in you, no one can stop you in achieving your goal.

SSB is all about a test of Personality. So groom your personality. For the OLQ, you need to keep the following things in mind- Implementation of Effective Intelligence during the interview Reasoning Ability capacity. Solve previous year questions given on online websites like Study IQ, VidyaGuru and similar other. You should be able to express your thoughts and substantiate them with reasons. The interviewers mark your self-confidence. It should always reflect on your answers as well as personality. A strong determination is the key to success. Keep things properly organized so that you do not have to rush through things during the last days of your interview. Take an initiative of learning things. You should be courageous and brave enough to face the interview. Do not be afraid of the interview before it actually takes place. Interact with your faculty members if you are a part of online or offline coaching. Take proper guidance from them. Always be responsible in what you do. Apart from all these factors, you need to listen to interviews of toppers who inspire you to crack an interview. Watch some of the videos on Study IQ YouTube channel.

Well the basic idea of the SSB interview is to determine if the candidate is worthy of becoming an army officer. The basic tests are General Aptitude and a few written exams along with physical tests and group tasks. To the best of my knowledge all these are to test the personality and to determine the general thought process and team skills which helps in painting an overall picture of the candidate. So my basic advice would be to concentrate on improving your vocabulary and speaking skills and along with your general knowledge. The most important part to clear the interview is to be informed as much as you can. It may range from sports and politics to the working of an engine. Be informed and be confident.

you got to find your own answer…. this is how i found mine…. i was god damn lazy chap …had to beat my ass up to get back up….when u are lazy u depend on external factors control u….change ua habits at the micro level…even as small as folding ua cloth n placing it at right place….practice practice practice those small things in ua daily life again and again…..then those small things will motivate u to do bigger things right….. n another thing u got to do is to question urself than asking it on quora…the answer that i wrote is my story…. this is wat motivated me….n still it does..n it ll forever…. key in life is to find ua own answer to motivate u to out efforts on a regular basis…. when u find that out…. u ll stop asking for other’s solutions to ua problem…. hope u ll find way of doing things right all the best

Well, first go through the SSB procedures and tests. A video is available for the same in Indian Army’s Website and Youtube. Then, the most important, enhance your ” Personality”. Yes, PERSONALITY. It is the only factor which will decide your selection. Go through some personality related Books. Know about yourself. Accept your negative points and work upon them. Enhance your positive ones. Exercise daily. Yes. Every single day, go for 3–4 kms Jog. Talk to your family, friends. Do what you like and build Good habits. You will succeed. As the officer once told us, “We want natural people. Not coated or coached ones”. Jai Hind.

There is no any sort of godly hardwork required to crack SSB!But u need to be dedicated for sure!! Eat right! Take care of ur body.(exercise and physical fitnesss) Follow a systematic time table. Dress well Feel good about yourself. Read lots of books(any genre). Thats what i did,which helped me sail through SSB. Candidates try to give their best and are so desperate for success that they hide their real self and fail in SSB. Be natural! Be confident in whatever u do and finally enjoy the process,dont take burden thinking about the failure(it the make the matter even more worse)!! Go there as if u r going for a five day holiday!🍻

I asked this same question to many people and they told me buy books.Practise previous papersDont do either of the above . At SSB They want honest answer and honest reactions from you . Just get to know what the 5 days will be like. Know the schedule and tasks and just glance at the sort of questions they ask . However don't go too deep especially for psychology stuff . Do read newspapers and know about Indian defence services . That is one thing you should know.

“ORIGINALITY” Just be what you are and act accordingly . Show the assessors your true image. This would certainly fancy your chances of getting recommended. You might have taken coaching for the SSB and I am not against it.All I want to say is that don’t just mug up things try to learn how to brush up your original personality rather than trying to become someone else during the training. The chances are very that your true image might get you through the test rather than some masked image.

SSB is one of the purest selection process for Indian Officers. When it comes to preparation for SSB I would say practice it in daily life. It is not something for which you should start your preparation just two months prior to SSB dates. Yes, do start preparation for SSB two months prior but that should be your GK, OIR, Brushing up the Graduation knowledge. Now SSB focuses on personality and perception of a person which takes time for improvement hence it doesn't matter you are going for SSB or not, just live a good life and your preparation is going on. Thanks for reading Cheers to selection.

I guess that’s all you can do. No wait! Hope for the best and prepare for the worst! Yup..that’s it!
